loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 59-year-old single man. For the past 36 years, he has worked selling tobacco from a small table on the side of the street. Youssef lost his right hand during the Lebanese war, but this issue didn't stop him from making his own living. He works for his living in order not to ask others for help. 

Youssef is a hardworking man. He applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to expand his merchandise with more boxes of tobacco in order to increase his income. Youssef will also benefit from the loan to do the necessary maintenance to his home's sanitary facilities.

Youssef's good reputation encourages his customers to support him. He dreams of opening his own shop in the future.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise and buy more boxes of tobacco.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a 36-year-old lady and married. She is blessed with two children namely: Oskar, 5 years old and Cynthia, 2 and a half years old. 

Emilia runs a kiosk business to assist her husband in generating more income for her family. She initiated the business using her own capital. Bath soap, detergent, stationery, cigarettes, candies and snacks are available on her kiosk.

Currently, Emilia wants to add more goods to her kiosk inventory because some goods ordered by the customer are not available at her kiosk, i.e., sugar, coffee, cooking oil and kitchen equipment. To purchase those goods, Emilia needs more money. She would like to request a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She really hopes that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase more stock s.

loans.name: Ivonny

texts.en:
Ivonny is a 31-year-old lady. She is married and has three children: Putri, 7, attending Elementary School grade 3; Putra, 4, attending kindergarten and Julian, 3. 

Ivonny runs a computer rental business; it is located near her residence. Currently she has 10 computers to rent. Ivonny operates her business from 9 am up to 11 pm; from the business Ivonny can help her husband in generating extra income for their family.

Ivonny really wants to improve the business by hiring out play station gadgets at her business place, but she needs more capital to do so. Ivonny is requesting IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. Ivonny has been a member of TLM’s Group Lending Program and has a good repayment record. She is hoping that TLM is willing to help her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase play station gadgets to be hired out.

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is 52 years old, a widow with ten children.

Candida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Candida has borrowed and paid for thirteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Candida aspires to save money to expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any other family members. 

Sarah sells charcoal in the market. She has been in business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through selling bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to own a delivery van to facilitate transportation and also to educate her children up to university level. 

Sarah lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is 54 years old. She is a widow and has four children. 

Dulce has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Dulce requested a PHP 14,000 loan  through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Dulce has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Dulce would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She has a beauty salon. She has been in business for the last 2 years. She works seven days a week. 

Shamim has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to educate her children up to university level and also to own a fully stocked salon. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 48 years old and married with nine children.

Nancy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling nipa (woven palm mats use for house construction and repair) in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Nancy has borrowed and paid for eighteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa business for twenty-two years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish, shrimps, shells, etc,.

Nancy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of palm mats to sell.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de animales como cuyes y gallinas,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en los mercados del distrito de Saylla,la socia por medio de este pequeño negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los animales.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to make her living selling animals such as guinea pigs and hens. She fattens them up and fosters their growth. Later she sells them in the markets in the Saylla district. 

Through this small business she is able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell her animals. She is requesting this loan to buy animals like guinea pigs and hens as well as animal feed. She is happy with the loan and she is committing to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Siguikafo Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  SIGUIKAFO sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à  NIENA, 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame AMINATA fait le commerce des chaussures dans ce groupe de femmes de   SIGUIKAFO  elle se tient  au milieu.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 30 paires de  chaussures pour femmes, 10 paires de  chaussures pour enfant au grand marché de la ville  de Bamako.
 Elle les revend au  grand marché de Niena  à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500 FCFA par mois dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The five members of the SIGUIKAFO group are mostly married women with an average age of 35, and they have on average 5 children each. They mostly live in monogamous families in Niena, the third largest administrative region of Mali. This is their first loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, in order to meet their customers' needs. Madame Aminata is a trader of shoes within the ladies of the SIGUIKAFO group, and she is standing in the middle.
With her loan, she intends to purchase 30 pairs of ladies shoes and 10 pairs of childrens shoes in the main market at the town of Bamako. She resells them in the main market in Niena at a fixed stand, and also among her family, to a customer base mostly made up of women, and for cash. She estimates making an average monthly profit of FCFA12,500 per month, a portion of which will be used to repay the loan with its interest, and the rest will be for her savings. She hopes to grow her business to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is 63 years old and married with four children. Elpedia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

Elpedia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, sugar, snack foods, soft drinks, etc.. 

In the future, Elpedia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is 50 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Phoebe has a fishing business in the Philippines. Phoebe requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Phoebe has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Phoebe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all of them go to school. She has two additional family members. She sells charcoal from home. She has been in this business for the last two years, and works seven days a week. 

Sarah has requested a loan of UGX 1,500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. She generates additional income by hiring out her motorcycle. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to educate her children to university level and also to become a wholesaler. 

She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling firewood, charcoal, and rice.

Teresita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store business.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Mila has been in this business for 25 years. Mila earns more income from raising pigs and food vending.

Mila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Ndèye

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est uen jeune femme, célibataire qui vend des produits ménagers notamment de l'encens.Elle exerce cette activité depuis bientôt deux ans et s'approvisionne chez les grands commercants venant des pays limitrophes.Elle parvient à obtenir des bénéfices consistants et à soutenir ses deux parents dans la prise ne charge de la famille mais aussi ses deux soeurs qui sont des élèves. Elle sollicite un pret de 100000f auprès de l'UIMCEC pour renforcer son fonds de commerce en achetant deux sacs d'encens.Son ambition est de faire des voyages de commerce.
texts.en: The borrower is a young, single woman who sells products for the home - notably incense. She has been doing this for almost two years, and purchases her stock at large traders in the neighbouring countries. She manages to generate a consistent monthly profit, and to support her parents in taking care of the family, as well as her two sisters who are at school. She is seeking a loan of 100,000f with UIMCEC in order to increase her stock with the purchase of two bags of incense. Her ambition is to go on business trips.

loans.use: to buy two bags of incense

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a kiosk at the market on retail basis. She has been in business for the last seven years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy sweets, biscuits, cakes and bags of bread. Her major challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her aspirational goal is to expand so as to operate a wholesale shop. She lives in her own house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sweets, biscuits, bags of bread, and cakes to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 22-year-old single hardworking man living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a motorcyclist and has been in that business for the last two years. He survives by riding other peoples' motorcycles and pays back 70 percent of his earnings to the owners. His challenge has been high fuel prices and transportation costs. His dream is to buy his own motorcycle, build a permanent home and buy land to grow crops.

Robert needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle.

loans.name: Sérigne Ousmane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié, père de deux enfants. Il vend divers matériaux recyclés tels que le fer et le bois.Il récupère ou achète les matériaux dans la ville, les nétoie et les revend à des entreprises qui les recyclent.Cette activité lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent d'entretenir son épouse, ses enfants et de soutenir aussi d'autres membres de sa famille. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter 10 sac de matériaux diverses qu'il va revendre à ses clients. Son ambition est de créer une petite entreprise dans sa ville pour augmenter sa production et employer quelques jeunes.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man, father of two children. He sells various recycled materials such as iron and wood. He collects or buys these materials in town, cleans them up and resells them to companies who recycle them. This business generates income which allows him to support his wife and children, and also to assist other members of his family. To increase his stock, he is seeking a loan of 200,000f to purchase 10 bags of various materials which he will resell to his customers. His ambition is to create a small business in his town, in order to increase his production and to employ a few young people.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of various materials

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Janepher sells used clothes on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last two years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of clothes. She generates additional income through selling charcoal. Her major business challenges are seasonality and defaulters. Her aspirations and goals are to expand into a wholesale business. 

She lives in her own house. The family has access electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 37-year-old married man, father of three adorable children. He has been working for 17 years as a builder, and his work is going on just well enough to cover his family's expenses.

Hicham is applying for a loan for the first time from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary building stones & tools for a new project he's going to get.

Hicham's reputation gives him customers' trust & support. Most of the customers are neighbors, relatives and friends, in addition to nearby villagers. He plans to expand his business more in the future to insure that his children will get the suitable education.

loans.use: To buy necessary building stones & tools for a new project.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a thirty-one-year-old man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has a personal goal of building a permanent house. He has been operating a retail shop for the last eleven years and his major hardship has been high transportation and taxes, however, he has a vision of moving his business to a more permanent location. Moses needs a loan to buy yoghurt, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy yoghurt, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter used the previous loan to buy chemicals for spraying his tomatoes and for paying his workers. Alongside his agricultural practices, he offers tailoring services to schools where he faces a challenge of seasonal customers and price fluctuations and inflation. Now that the term has started, Peter needs the loan to buy uniform materials to sew.

loans.use: to buy materials to make uniforms  to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 40 years old and lives in Barnesville. She is married and she has eight children between thirteen and twenty-six years old. They are in school and live at home. 

For the past twenty years, she has been selling rice and charcoal. She is requesting the loan to purchase more rice and charcoal to sell in her business. She has a lot of customers and makes a lot of profit. Her plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a thirty-six-year-old lady from Migori County. She is married to Solomon and they have four children.

Jane operates pharmacy shop in Migori town, a business she has had for the last four years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking a school fees loan from KADET LTD which she will use to pay school fees for her child.

Her dream is to have a stable business and also to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Máxima

texts.es: Máxima de 42 años vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 12 a 20 años, nacida en el departamento de Bolívar, se ha dedicado al comercio de pescados y venta de pudines en compañía de su cónyuge, negocios con los que sostienen su hogar y ambos sueñan hacerlos crecer, para generar ingresos cada vez mayores que aumenten su bienestar y permitan lograr una educación de calidad a sus hijos. En el negocio de venta de bocachicos  y mojarras especialmente, su esposo lo distribuye personalmente casa a cas en barrios aledaños a su vivienda, pero no muy cerca, porque Máxima vende desde su casa y su mercado son las familias que tiene mas cerca y que le encargan, las compras las realiza su esposo en el mercado y las ventas son de estricto contado. Ultimamente su clientela ha aumentado, porque reconocen la frescura de los productos que ellos venden y por eso requiere capital de trabajo para comprar en mayor proporción, que lo que hasta ahora con sus propias fuerzas puede lograr. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el que comprará pescados para responder a su demanda. Máxima tambien genera ingresos mediante la venta de pudines pequeños, que vende desde su casa y que de mucho le sirven, porque rota todos los dias su dinero mientras obtiene ganancias.
texts.en:
42-year old Máxima lives south of the city with her husband and their three children aged from 12 to 20 years. She was born in Bolívar Department. Together with her husband Máxima has a business selling fish and she also sells puddings. They use the income from these two jobs to support the household and would like to expand the businesses so they can earn more money and have a better life. As well, they wish to provide their children with a good education.

Máxima’s husband takes the bocachicos and mojarras (types of fish) to distant neighbourhoods and sells them door to door, whilst Máxima sells from the house. Her customers are families who live nearby. Her husband buys from the market and sells strictly on account. Their customer base has increased of late because people recognise the freshness of their product, so they now need more money to buy more fish. Up until now they have been able to finance this themselves. Now Máxima is asking for a loan, the first she’s had from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy fish. She also earns money from the sale of little puddings which she sells from her house. She alternates  between selling fish and selling puddings so as to earn money.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a twenty-six-year-old lady from Nyalenda in Kisumu City.  She is married to Elias and the couple has two children, aged 7 and 10 years old.

Millicent operates a food stall where she makes mandazis (a type of fried bread) and sells them to her clients.  She has been in this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy cooking fat and baking flour. 

Her profits will be used to educate her children. Her dream is to own a hotel.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat and baking flour.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 40 years old and lives in Barnesville. She is married and has eight children between 10 and 23 years of age that live at home and attend school. She has been involved in selling cooked food (a restaurant business) for the past twenty years, She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, and charcoal, etc., for her business. She has a lot of customers and makes a lot of profit. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, peppers, oil, and charcoal, etc., for restaurant business.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia is 25 years old and a single lady from Nakuru. She has a business of selling cosmetics products and has been doing this for the past three years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more beauty products to add to her stock. She hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to her stocks of sugar, soap, and milk for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a forty-year-old hard working lady with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children. 

Janet has been dealing in second-hand clothes for the last thirteen years. Her major hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase stock, however, she has a vision of expanding her business into new markets. 

Janet needs a loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 34-year-old married man and doesn't have children yet. He lives in Aden, Yemen. Since 2009 he has been operating his own business where he sells toys in a shop. He started his business in the surroundings of his city but it couldn`t run well because he was bothered with some problems with people. Then he moved and found a shop and began selling games, toys and comics in a very commercial area. 

In spite of life going on and his not having any kids, he is very kindly man who is soft-hearted with the children who come to his shop. His business has gradually grown and he has specialized in everything.

Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. So, he requested 80,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase goods for his business that will  increase his profit.

In the future, Majed hopes to expand his business and make it a bookshop in order to get more money so that  he can go to a great hospital to be able to have a child.

loans.use: to purchase goods for his business that will increase his profit.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 33 years old from Ndunyu-Njeru and is married with one daughter who is two months old.

Dominic is a tailor and has been in this business for the past ten years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy more cloth to make dresses to sell.

He hopes to expand his business and employ one person to help him manage it.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for making dresses.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is thirty one years old.  She is a mother of two children, aged 5 and 10 years, and she is married to Clement. They reside in Kakamega town, Western Kenya.

Everlyn runs a beauty shop in Kakamega town.  She has had this business she the last year. From the business, she earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy beauty products like hair chemicals. She will plow the profits she makes back into her business. Her dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a forty-one-year-old man from the Kapune area of Kilgoris.  He is married to Margaret and they have five children who range in age from 1 to 14 years.

Joshua operates a livestock selling business, mainly cattle, and has been doing this for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of KES 12,200. He is taking his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy cattle for resale. 

He will use the profits to diversify into a retail shop business. His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 58 years old. A mixed crop farmer, he is widowed with three children. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 9,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan. Peter will use the loan to buy seedling and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedling and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her elderly parents).    

Florence has a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Florence sells her products in a shop, retail.    Florence has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, a hand dryer, weaves and braids.  

The main business challenges for Florence include seasonality and the on-and-off electricity. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal salon and also to educate her children up to university. Florence lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, a hand dryer, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a married mother of 3 children, all of whom are of school going age. She owns a produce business where she buys and sells produce, like beans, maize, and others. She faces a challenge of high fuel and transport costs and she hopes to expand her business to new markets. Her personal goal is to educate her children and she intends to use the loan to buy maize, beans, and rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, and maize.

loans.name: Bunda

texts.en:
Bandu lives in Paynesville. She is twenty-nine, single and has two children aged one and ten. The oldest is in school and they both live at home. 

For the past seven years, Bandu has been selling fashion clothes. She learned this way of selling from her friends, and started the business with money given to her by a friend. She likes her business because it helps her to support her children. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes, such as blouses, for her business. In the future, she would like to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes to sell in her business.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last one and a half years. She works seven days a week. 

Jesca has requested a loan of UGX 1,200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the increasing prices of used clothes. Her aspirations and goals are to buy a plot of land and also to start selling wholesale. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Samuel E.o's Group

texts.en:
This is Samuel, Alice, and Moses, workers at the Department of Youth and Sport in Makeni. Because government salaries are usually very small and do not allow workers to do something big, they are seeking a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders to allow them invest in something meaningful. Some will invest their loans in business and others will invest in the education of their children. And at the end of each month, they will repay their Kiva loan, using their monthly salaries. 

Samuel is the leader of this group of borrowers. He is fifty-three years of age. He was born in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. Samuel is married with three children who are attending secondary schools. His wife is also a monthly wage earner, working for FAWE (Forum for African Women Education) in Freetown. Samuel has worked for the Ministry for twenty-six years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.name: Aminata K.

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above is Aminata, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. Aminata has been a professional teacher for six years now. A native of Makeni, Aminata is aged thirty-two. She is married to a police officer and the couple has one child together. 

Aminata has requested this loan in order to pay her child's school fees. At the end of each month, Aminata will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay her child's school fees.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above is Mary, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. A native of Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone, Mary is aged fifty-two. She is married to a nurse and the couple has seven children together.  Her children are attending secondary school. 

Mary has requested for this loan in order to pay school fees for her children. At the end of each month, Mary will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Paul J.

texts.en:
We are very please to introduce to you Paul, a primary school teacher in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Born in Makeni city, the forty-six-year-old is married to a trader and the couple has four children. 

Paul has come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan. With the help of this loan, he can solve some of the financial challenges that with his salary alone he cannot solve.  But with the help of this loan, he can meet some of his immediate financial challenges and then repay the loan using his monthly salary. Paul will use this loan to pay school fees for his children. Paul has three children in primary school and one in secondary school.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Saeed is 37 years old and married with four children. He lives in Ibb, Yemen, and runs an iron welding  workshop to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed two people. He started working ten years ago, as an employee on a daily cash wage with someone who has the same business. Then he worked hard to save money until he was able to open his own welding workshop. 

Saeed describes his business environment as good because he is visited regularly by his customers. He has been able to improve his business. He has applied for 220,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a generator for his business that works when the power is off.

In the future, he hopes to have an aluminum workshop so that his profit will allow him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator  that works when the power is off for his business.

loans.name: Isa

texts.ru: Isa uje 11 let kak rabotayet taxistom. S molodix let on interesovalsya etoy rabotoy. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 1500 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti dlya mashini. Isa ochen trudolubiviy chelovek. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Isa 58 let. On jivet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy. On lubit svoyu jenu i poetomu on userdno rabotayet chtobi on mog oplachivat lecheniye svoyey jeni.
texts.en: Isa has been working as a taxi driver for eleven years. He wanted to be a driver since he was young. Currently Isa needs 1500 AZN in order to buy necessary spare parts for his taxi cab. Isa is a very hard working man from Baku region. He is 58 years old, married and has three children. His wife is sick, and Isa loves his wife dearly. He works diligently to be able to afford medical treatment for his spouse.

loans.use: to purchase necessary spare parts

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 53 years old. He lives in the village of Kistauri, East Georgia, with his family: his wife Eteri, two sons (33 and 11 years old), a daughter (13 years old), his daughter-in-law and 4-year-old granddaughter. George works as a shepherd in the village. His monthly salary is 100 Laris. His elder son is a worker in the village. The younger son has health problems and receives a relevant pension from the government. His daughter goes to school. According to the Credo scoring system, George’s family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Their average monthly income is 320 Laris, including the monthly pension of George’s son. 

George requested a loan for re-starting the agricultural business of the family, which was stopped two years ago, because of his son’s health problems. With the credit the family will cultivate the plot of the land and sow maize. They will sell the harvest and receive additional income, which will slightly improve the living conditions of the family. Also a small part of the credit will be used for the renovation of a small part of the house, which is old and without any renovation.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and purchase maize for sowing and to renovate a small part of his house.

loans.name: Nanah B.

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above is Nanah, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. A native of Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone, Nanah is aged thirty. She is married to a businessman and the couple has two children together.  

Nanah has requested this loan in order to invest it in her business. She will use it to buy market food such as palm-oil, etc. to sell. At the end of each month, Nanah will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: buy market food such as palm-oil to sell.

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru: Абдучалил житель города Исфары. Он женат. Ему 52 года. У него двое детей. Он имеет высшее образование. По профессии он инженер-технолог. В этой области он проработал 15 лет. На сегодняшний день Абдучалил занимается скотоводством. Он в основном закупает крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Abdujalil lives in Isfara. He is 52 years old, married and has two children. Abdujalil has a college degree in engineering and has been working as an engineer for fifteen years. Now Abdujalil raises cattle for resale at the meat market. He is taking this loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
Manuel pertenece  a la alcancía comunal  Sarita Colonia compuesta  por siete integrantes que se dedican a  diversos comercios  pero teniendo en común el deseo de superación y de salir adelante por el bienestar de sus familias. Manuel de 66 años de edad casado y con seis hijos de los cuales  cinco son independientes y  uno aun esta a su cuidado. El se dedica a la enseñaza en un colegio hace 31 años, El cual inicio desde que llego a vivir en su localidad, con la profesion de docente hasta hoy en dia a logrado mejorar su casa y dar mayores comodidades a su hogar así también  cubrir gastos como alimentación y estudios para sus hijos. El le gustaría seguir ayudando al colegio en donde enseña dando clases. Con el reciente préstamo ayudara con los gastos de salud de su esposa . Un grupo con el solo objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones económicas es lo que caracteriza a esta alcancía comunal Sarita Colonia. 
La Sra. Kathy Rocio no puedo estar presente por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Manuel belongs to the “Sarita Colonia” communal bank which has seven members who carry out a variety of commercial activities but have in common the desire to improve and get ahead for the wellbeing of their families.

Manuel, 66, is married and has six children five of which are independent and one is still in his care.  He has been a teacher for 31 years, a job he started since he came to live in his community.  With his work in this profession he’s managed to date to improve his house and provide more comfort at home as well as provide food and education for his children.  He’d like to continue helping the school where he teaches classes.    He will use the present loan to help with his wife’s medical costs.  

A group whose only objective is to improve their economic conditions is what characterizes this “Sarita Colonia” communal bank. Sra. Kathy Rocio could not be present for work reasons.

loans.use: to pay for medicines.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is fifty-six years old and married with twelve children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ofelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock of products to sell in her general store. Ofelia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, soap, canned goods, and snack foods.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of products to sell.

loans.name: Hamdam

texts.ru: Хамдам прожвает в городе Исфара. Ему 50 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Хамдам занимается торговлей детских игрушек и конфет. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Hamdam lives in Isfara. He is 50 years old, married and a father to one child. Hamdam sells toys and candy on the street. He has been working as a street vendor for four years. Hamdam is taking out this loan to increase goods turn over.

loans.use: to expand inventory and increase goods turn over

loans.name: Hamro

texts.ru: Хамро проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 69 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Он более 12 лет занимается животноводством. Кредит берет для закупа мелко - рогатого скота и корма.
texts.en: Hamro lives in Shahrituz region. He is 69 years old, married and has five children. He has raised animals for more then twelve years. Hamro is planning to use this loan to buy fodder and more animals for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase sheep, goats and fodder

loans.name: Ozodakhon

texts.ru: Озодахон проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она занимается шитьем и торговлей матрасов. Также она шьет стеганные одеяла. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки тканей.
texts.en: Ozodakhon lives in Isfara. She is 57 years old, married and has two children. Ozodakhon makes and sells mattresses and quilts. She has worked as a seamstress for twenty years. Ozodakhon is taking out this loan to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмон 42 - летний женатый мужчина. У него четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он у себя дома разводит мелко - рогатый скот. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа овец.
texts.en: Abdurahmon is a 42 year old husband and a father of four. His spouse is a home maker. Abdurahmon himself raises sheep for a living. He has had his herd for seven years and is planning to use this loan to buy more sheep.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Myagmarbaatar

texts.en:
Myagmarbaatar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Central Mongolia. His wife makes traditional clothes and sells them in the local area. Their two children are school students and one is sick and stays home. 

Since 2009, he had been working as as an auxiliary to the entrepreneurs at the market, but in 2011, he started selling flour and pine nuts in the area's central market. He would like to continue his business successfully with some help. Based on his experience and the good shop counter position, he would like to buy additional supplies. He is a hard-working guy who says, 'I would like to extend my business for the well-being of my children. My son is an outpatient.  We face the problem of paying for his treatment'. The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to purchase more nuts.

loans.use: To purchase more nuts

loans.name: Fallah

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you Fallah, a primary school teacher in Makeni.

41-year-old Fallah was born in Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married and has four children. His wife is a student and his children are attending primary and secondary schools. Fallah has served in the teaching profession for 20 years now. He has requested this loan to pay school fees for his children. He will use the rest of the loan to buy house building materials, including iron corrugated zincs, nails, and cements, for the construction of a house.

loans.use: to pay his school fees for his children and to buy house building materials.

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es:
La sra. Luz es separada, tiene 36 años de edad y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.
La sra. Luz estudia Educacion en una universidad, eligió esta profesión por vocación y también sabe que le generara mejores ingresos económicos, hoy en día trabaja vendiendo helados en la calle desde hace 7 años. La sra. luz cuenta que toda su motivacion para salir adelante son sus hijos, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicacion  sus hijos van a la escuela y sobre todo cuentan con una mejor calidad de vida, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para pagar su especializacion en eduacacion. 
La Sra. Luz cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz is separated, 36, and has two school-aged children. Luz is an education major at a prestigious university. Luz chose this profession because it is her calling and she also knows that it generates better earnings. These days she works selling ice cream on the street which she has done for seven years. Luz tells us that her motivation for getting ahead comes entirely from her children and that, without them, she would not have the energy to continue. Thanks to her effort and dedication her children go to school and above all they have a better quality of life. 

With the goal of continuing to grow she has requested a new loan to pay for her specialized studies in Education. With lots of hard work, Sra. Luz will comply with her goals and the loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to pay for her advanced studies in Education.

loans.name: Caminando Juntos Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sabina  es conviviente, tiene 49 años de edad actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Caminando juntos” grupo  conformado por 11 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.  La Sra. Sabina  trabaja desde hace 11 años en la venta de comida  es decir vende a almuerzos en una fabrica.
Este negocio surge porque sabina queria obtener una independencia economica, para ayudar a su esposo y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Cuenta con clientes fidelizados, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos, logrando mejorar su calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para la  adquisicion de utensilios de cocina como platos, cubiertos y etc. la Sra. sabina cumplira sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Señora Sabina is 49 years old an lives with her partner.  She is currently a member of the communal bank "Caminando juntos", which is made up of 11 members who are dedicated to different business activities.  Sabina has been selling breakfast foods at a factory for 11 years.  She started this business because she wanted financial independence to help her husband and to be able to provide for her children.  Over time, she has gained loyal customers because of her hard work and dedication to improving her income.  Little by little, she bought things for her household and above all, her family has a better quality of life.  With the goal of continuing to grow, she is requesting a new loan for things like plates, silverware, etc.  With hard work Sabina will fulfill her goals and the Edaprospo loans will help her.

loans.use: purchase of cooking utensils such as dishes, cutlery and more.

loans.name: Joseph A.

texts.en: Joseph is a primary school teacher in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Joseph is 47 years old and married with five children attending primary and secondary schools. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children. Joseph will repay his Kiva loan using his monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Pictured above is Jenneh, a primary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. The 30-year-old has served in the teaching profession for 7 years now. Jenneh is married to a teacher and the couple has two children – one is attending primary school and the other is in secondary school.

Jenneh has requested this loan in order to pay her college fees. At the end of each month, she will repay the loan using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay her college fees.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl, es muy emprendedor, el vive en la ciudad de Nasca, La ciudad es famosa por la legendaria Líneas de Nazca, una serie de antiguos, inmenso e inexplicable geroglíficos  grabados en el desierto que rodea la ciudad, generalmente atribuidos a la cultura Nazca, que habitaron en la región de 300 a 800 AD. Como tal, la ciudad atrae a una cantidad considerable de turismo. Pero Nazca también es conocida por su gente trabajadora, que han conservado  la calma a pesar de los frecuentes terremotos, tsunamis, y un alto nivel de pobreza en la regió.  Raul es conviviente y su pareja lo apoya mucho en su negocio,  ellos trabajan juntos siempre, Raul nos comenta que no se separan para nada, el nos dice que es su brazo derecho y que ella le da fuerzas para continuar. 

Raúl se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa interior, viene trabajando en este negocio alrededor de 20 años y aprendió el manejo del mismo, debido a que desde pequeño ayudaba a su padre que también tiene este tipo de negocio, Raul se esfuerza mucho  trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias y cuando son fechas de épocas festivas a veces no va a su casa  a almorzar, con tal de seguir vendiendo sus productos y tener más ingresos para su familia, el y su esposa se sacrifican mucho por salir adelante siempre son un duo dianmico como el dice.

Raul está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada el podrá comprar más mercadería (ropas de baño, lencería de verano), esta mejora ayudara a que tenga más variedad de productos que ofrecer, y así obtener más ingresos para seguir ahorrando y cumplir su gran sueño: “Crecer aun mas en su Negocio y Familia”
texts.en:
Raúl is very enterprising.  He lives is Nazca, a city famous for the legendary Líneas de Nazca, a series of immense, ancient, unexplainable geoglyphs carved in the desert that surrounds the city.  Generally, these carvings are attributed to members of the Nazca culture who lived in the region from 300 to 800 A.D.   The city attracts a considerable amount of tourists.   But Nazca is also known for its hard-working people who have remained calm in spite of the frequent earthquakes and tsunamis, and the high level of poverty in the region.  Raúl lives in a common-law relationship and his partner supports him in his business; they always work together.  Raúl tells us that they are never apart; she is his right arm and gives him the strength to go on.  

Raúl has been in the business of selling undergarments for about twenty years.  Raul’s father is also in this type of business and at a young age, Raul started helping his father and learned how to manage the business. Raúl tries very hard and works about ten hours a day.  Sometimes, during the holiday season, for the sake of selling more merchandise and having more income for his family, he doesn’t go home for lunch.  He says that he and his wife sacrifice a great deal to get ahead; they are a dynamic duo.  

Raúl is very grateful for the Kiva loans since the support will enable him to buy more merchandise (swimwear, summer lingerie).  This improvement will enable him to offer a wider variety of products and in this way, earn more income and continue saving to fulfill his great dream: “To grow his business and his family even more.”

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (swimwear and summer lingerie).

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui conduit depuis deux ans une motocyclette de transport urbain.Chaque soir, il perçoit une part des recettes journalières dont les deux reviennet au propriétaire de la moto.Ce modeste revenu lui permet de subvenir tant bien que mal à ses propres besoins et de soutenir ses deux parents. Il a ouvert un compte à l'UIMCEC et sollicite un pret de 300 000f pour acheter sa propre motocyclette afin de maximiser ses bénéfices. Son ambition est de constituer un parc de motocyclettes qui constituent le principal moyen de transport dans sa ville.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young single man who has been driving a city motorcycle taxi for two years. At the end of each day, he earns one third of the day's takings, with the other two thirds going to the owner of the motorcycle. This modest income allows him to meet his own needs and support his parents as best he can. 

He has opened an account with UIMCEC and is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy a motorcycle of his own, in order to maximize profits. His goal is to build up a fleet of motorcycles that would be the principal method of transportation in his town.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle of his own.

loans.name: Cristhian Hans

texts.es:
Cristhian es un joven de 29 años con una actitud muy positiva , es soltero y vive en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad con extensiones las tierras agrícolas son de primera calidad, las cuales son completadas con aguas permanentes de regadío en donde destacan la presencia de canales de riego que tienen enorme incidencia en la producción y productividad agraria; Cristhian es un joven muy trabajador, para tener su negocio actual he trabajado realizando varios oficios, primero trabajo en el campo, luego trabajo de mozo en un restaurante y luego como obrero en una fabrica; el poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ello pudo formar su negocio y sobre todo seguir estudiando ya que actualmente está en la universidad y cursa la carrera de Derecho.

Cristhian se dedica a la venta de locería (venta de platos, ollas, tasas, entre otros) y artículos de limpieza; lleva ya 5 años trabajando en este rubro, diariamente le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día; él cree  que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque siempre tiene productos novedosos y los clientes se animan a comprar sus productos.

Cristian está muy feliz y agradecido por la ayuda brindada por los prestatarios Kiva ya que con este apoyo el podrá comprar cilindros para el almacenamiento de agua, ya que sus clientes le han hecho varios pedidos, con esta mejora podrá cumplir con sus cliente y sobre todo podrá tener más mercadería para ofrecer, lo que le ayudara a tener más ingresos lo que le permitirá ahorrar para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:”Terminar su carrera y tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Christhian is 29 years old and has a very positive attitude.   He is single and lives in the city of Imperial, which is surrounded by top-quality farmland.   There is abundant water, and there are irrigation canals that help increase the productivity of the farming activities enormously. 

He is a very hardworking young man.  In order to have his current business he worked in many jobs. First, he worked on farms, then as a waiter in a restaurant, and after that he worked in a factory.  All this time he was saving money little by little in order to start his business and above all to continue studying.  He is currently studying law at the university.

He sells dishware (plates, pans, cups, and other items) and cleaning supplies.  He has been doing this for five years.  Each day he works in his business for around 9 hours and can serve up to 15 customers per day. He believes his business is going well because he is very friendly with his customers and because he always has new products that his customers are happy to buy.

Chisthian is very happy and grateful for the help that Kiva lenders bring, since with this support he will be able to buy water containers. His customers have made many requests to him, and with this loan he will better be able to meet his customers’ needs and have more merchandise to offer.  This will help bring him more income, which will permit him to save money in order to fulfill his greatest dream:  “to finish my studies and to have a bigger business.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (water containers).

loans.name: Elgar Misael

texts.es:
Elgar Misael, tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su familia en la colonia Paz Rivera de Cofradia Cortes.
Cuando estaba mas joven realizaba trabajos de agricultura, y tuvo la idea de superarse trabajando en lo propio. Y hace 18 años que estableció una barbería, comenzando con lo poco que tenia. .ofrece los servicios de corte de pelo, barba y vende productos de barbería. Trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m todos los días.
Elgar, a hecho crecer su negocio, tiene mas herramientas para hacer mejores trabajos de corte de pelo.
Actualmente esta solicitando el cuarto préstamo para comprar más herramientas y productos necesarios para la barbería como cremas, espejos tijeras, maquinas de cortar pelo y otros. 
Su gran sueño es formar una empresa de barbería  y contratar barberos para brindar un mejor servicio, atendiendo a más clientes y así incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Elgar Misael, 36, is single living with his family in the Paz Rivera neighborhood of Cofradía, Cortes.  When he was younger he worked in farming but got the idea to improve by working for himself.  Eighteen years ago he set up a barber shop starting it with what little he had.  He offers haircuts, beard trimming and sells barber supplies.  He works from 9am until 7pm every day.

Elgar has caused his business to grow he has more tools to make better haircuts.  He is currently asking for the fourth loan to buy more tools and products needed for the barber shop like creams, mirrors, scissors, hair clippers and others.  His great dream is to establish a barbering firm and hire barbers to provide better service tending to more customers thus increasing his income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his barber shop.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Alcides tiene 33 años de edad, convive con Haydee de 27 años de edad, fruto de esta relación tienen 5 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Llochegua. Alcides es un hombre lleno de experiencia y virtudes para el trabajo en la agricultura, pues él en la actualidad se dedica al cultivo de café orgánico. Actividad que lo realiza en su propia parcela. Asimismo pertenece a una asociación de productores agropecuarios donde están buscando ser reconocido por lo productos orgánicos que siembran, este es el caso del café y el cacao para que el precio de sus productos tenga un trato especial. Alcides está feliz con su trabajo y sus labores que realiza. Su mayor anhelo es la de conseguir ser reconocido como productor orgánico y obtener una certificación por su labor. Este es su primer crédito con MFP por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente en el pago de sus cuotas. Alcides esta conforme con su banco comunal por que son puntuales. Con los 1500 nuevos soles contratará peones para que limpien y fertilicen su campo agrícola.
texts.en:
Alcides, 33, lives with his partner, Haydee, 27, they have 5 children and  live in their own house in the Llochegua district.  Alcides has lots of experience and capability for his work in farming and he currently grows organic coffee on his own fields.  He belongs to an association of agricultural producers that are sought after for the organic products that they plant, in this case coffee and cacao because they earn high prices.  Alcides is happy with his business and the work that he does.  His biggest challenge is to be known as an organic farmer and receive the certification for his work.  This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to be punctual with his payments.  Alcides likes the communal bank because the members are punctual.

He will use the 1500 new sols to hire farm workers so that they clean and fertilize his fields.

loans.use: to hire farm workers.

loans.name: Haide Suigeins

texts.es:
Haide tiene 34 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 4 y 8 añitos a los que ama muchísimo y a los cuales ha sacado adelante sola ya que ella es madre soltera, pero eso no la deprime, más bien hace que  tenga un buen motivo para salir adelante; a Haide le gusta mucho la cocina; es por ello que se animo a tener su negocio de venta de dulces y postres; ella empezó su negocio desde hace ya 1 año con mucho sacrifico y dedicación, ella inicio su negocio vendiendo sus tortas y dulces a sus vecinos, actualmente vende sus productos por todo su barrio .

Haide está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar más insumos y materiales para poder elaborar sus tortas y dulces ya que por ser temporada de verano y vacaciones de los niños de su barrio, gracias a ello podra elaborar mas Tortas y Dulces para ofrecer a sus clientes y con ello tener más ingresos para poder tener un negocio mas grande y cumplir sus mas grandes sueños: “Darle una profesión a sus hijos y tener un local para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Haide, 34, is the mother of two children whose ages are 4 and 8 years; she loves them very much and is raising them alone since she’s a single mother.  This does not depress her; however, on the contrary it causes her to have a good reason to get ahead.  Haide likes to cook very much and this is why she ventured to have a business selling sweets and desserts.  She started the business a year ago with much sacrifice and dedication.  She started it selling Bundt cakes and sweets to her neighbors and currently sells her products throughout her neighborhood.

Haide is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy more ingredients and supplies to make her cakes and sweets since it’s summer and the children in her neighborhood are on vacation.  Thanks to this she will be able to make more cakes and sweets to offer her customers and earn more income so that she can have a bigger business and make her greatest dream come true:  “To give her children a profession and to have a locale for her business.”

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bundt cakes and sweets.

loans.name: Gladis Del Carmen

texts.es: Gladis del Carmen, es una emprendedora que ha iniciado su propio negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, ya tiene experiencia en el negocio y además conoce lo que piden sus clientes. Ella inicio este negocio con el objetivo de generar ingresos a la familia y sacar a sus hijos adelante, ya cuenta con clientes fijos y eventuales que le ofrece su producto. Gladis del Carmen esta solicitando crédito para comprar mercadería como variedad de ropa, zapato, sandalias entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Gladis del Carmen is an entrepreneur who started her own business selling general merchandise. She already has experience in this business and knows what her customers want to order. Gladis started this business so that she could generate income for her family and help her children move forward. She already has loyal customers to whom she can offer her products.

Gladis del Carmen is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as a variety of clothes, shoes, sandals, and other products.

loans.use: to buy  clothes, shoes, sandals, and other products.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos con edades entre 10 a 30  años, vive con su familia en la aldea Suyapa de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Elsa Marina, trabajaba como cajera en una empresa privada, ha sido una mujer trabajadora  y sola ha podido sacar sus hijos adelante, hace 18 años logro establecer con sus propios fondos un negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y útiles escolares. Ella atiende su negocio desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
Doña Elsa ha podido superar su negocio con las ganancias obtenidas y también con préstamos que le  han ayudado a mantenerlo activo. Ha solicitado varios préstamos y con este actual de 15,000 lempiras lo invertirá en comprar útiles escolares como cuadernos, lápices, colores, sacapuntas, mochilas y uniformes, para esta época escolar actual. 
Su meta es seguir trabajando y superarse más económicamente y poder ofrecer mejor calidad de vida y educación  a sus hijos de menor edad.
texts.en:
Elsa is 51 years old and a single mother of four children between the ages of 10 and 30. She lives with her family in the neighborhood of Suyapa in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Elsa Marina works as a cashier at a private company. Being a hardworking woman, she is able to help her children move forward by herself. Eighteen years ago, she used her own funds to establish a business where she sells clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and school supplies. She manages her business between 7am until 8pm. Doña Elsa was able to excel in her business with the profits she earned. In addition, the loans have helped her to remain active. She has requested several loans and this current one in the amount of 15,000 HNL will be invested in school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, pencil sharpeners, backpacks, and uniforms for the current school year.

Her goals are to continue working, succeed financially, and be able to offer a better quality of life and an education to her younger children.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, pencil sharpeners, backpacks, and uniforms.

location.town: Aldea Suyapa, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Carmen Gertrudes

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer de actitud muy carismática, la cual vive en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, por sus playas hermosas y porque su actividad principal es el sembrío de arroz; Carmen tiene un hijo de 23 años, Carmen ya es abuela y uno de sus pasatiempos es salir a caminar con su nieto al cual adora mucho porque es muy cariñoso; Carmen como buena peruana le gusta mucho nuestra comida, por ello su palto favorito es el pescado frito, ella estudio solo hasta el tercer año de educación secundaria ya que sus padres no tenían los medios suficientes.

Carmen trabaja en su negocio de venta de salchipapas (papas fritas acompañadas de hotdog y salsas), salchipollo (papas fritas acompañadas de pollo frito y salsas) y caldo de gallina; en el día le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas y puede atender hasta 40 clientes; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porte es muy carismática, da un buen trato a los clientes y sobre todo porque el trabajar para ella es un gusto y le satisface trabajar.

Carmen agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio como gaseosa, ya que actualmente cuando compra este producto en poca cantidad le sale muy caro, esta mejora le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y ofrecer más productos a sus clientes, con ello podrá seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su sueño:”Tener un negocio más grande”
texts.en:
Carmen has a very charismatic attitude; she lives in the city of Camaná which is characterized by its hot climate, its beautiful beaches and because its main crop is rice.  Carmen has a 23-year-old son; she’s already a grandmother and one of her pastimes is to go out walking with her grandson who she adores because he’s very affectionate.  Like all good Peruvians, Carmen enjoys our cuisine very much but her favorite dish is fried fish.  She only studied up to third year of secondary school because her parents lacked sufficient resources.

Carmen works at her business selling “salchipapas” (fried potatoes served with hotdogs and sauces), “salchipollo” (fried potatoes served with fried chicken and sauces) and chicken soup.  She spends about 8 hours daily at her work and can serve up to 40 customers.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s very charismatic, she gives good customer service and above all because work for her is a joy and she likes to work.

Carmen is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support they’ve given her she’ll be able to buy more merchandise for the business like soft-drinks because when she has to buy this type of product in small amounts it’s more expensive.  This improvement will allow her to earn more income and to have more products for her customers so she can continue saving up to make her dream come true: “To have a larger business.”

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CUSI COYLLOR DE CHINCHERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Celina; ella tiene 20 años de edad; conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de comida, la socia elabora diversos platos como arroz con pollo,saltado,sopas de pollo y carne entre otros ,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria en las ferias en Cusco los días sabados,Chinchero los días domingos y Urubamba los días miércoles, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien ,la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida como arroz, aceite, fideos entre otros.

La socia se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the communal bank “CUSI COYLLORY DE CHINCHERO.”  The bank is located in the district of Chincero, which is in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The borrower is Celina, who is 20 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their child.  She has a business selling food.  She makes many different types of dishes, such as rice with chicken, chicken soup, pollo saltado, and others.

Celina alternates her daily activities in her business.  She sells her dishes in markets in Cusco on Saturdays, in Chinchero on Sundays, and in Urubamba on Wednesdays.   She enjoys doing this, and her business is going well.  She is a very happy and responsible person who has a strong desire to help her family make progress.

She is seeking this loan to buy supplies for her business, such as rice, oil, noodles and other items.  She promises to pay back her loan on schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business, such as rice, oil, noodles and other items.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 33 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos de 13,13 y 4 años de edad y estudian, el vive con su familia en la aldea Cuyamapa,  Morazán, Yoro.
Hace dos años que Francisco se dedica a la venta de ropa usada como ropa de cama, chamarras o abrigos y ropa casual y la vende en las comunidades vecinas. Este  negocio lo logro establecer con mucho esfuerzo e  invirtiendo sus propios fondos, ya que el trabajó anteriormente  en  albañilería, soldadura y electricidad. El dedica sábado y domingo a su negocio. 
Actualmente el solicita un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para invertir en  la compra de fardos de ropa de cama y de ropa casual, para poder ofrecer producto nuevo a su clientes, y hacer crecer mas su negocio y sus ingresos. 
Su meta es  darles a sus hijos la educación necesaria y en el futuro construirle a cada uno su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Francisco is 33 years old, married, and has three children (two 13-year-olds and a 4-year-old) who are in school. He lives with his family in the neighborhood of Cuyamapa in Morazán Yoro.

For the past two years, Francisco has been selling bedding and used clothing such as jackets, coats, and casual articles in the neighboring communities. He established this business with great effort and invested his own funds. Francisco previously held jobs doing masonry, welding, and electrical work. He spends Saturdays and Sundays at his business.

Francisco is currently requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to invest in the purchase of bundles of bedding and casual clothes so that he can offer new products to his customers and grow his business and his income. His goal is to provide his children with the necessary education. In the future, he would like to build a home for each one of them.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bedding and casual clothes.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael vive en el municipio de San Jacinto, tierra caracterizada por sus bellas hamacas y mochilas en tejido vertical, actividad tradicional en esta región del país. Su hogar lo conforma su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 2 y 7 años, a quienes planea generar tanto bienestar como el que pueda,  trabajando persistentemente en su negocio de elaboración de bolsos en tejido vertical, con el que actualmente genera ingresos, pero que considera tiene un alto potencial de crecimiento,  que aun no ha explorado  y a él le interesa proyectar su crecimiento para ganar mas dinero. Esta actividad lo aprendió mientras trabajaba en otro taller, donde se dedicaba a tejer bolsos en telar y cuando estuvo preparado se independizó y emprendió su sueño,  de poner en marcha su propio negocio. Con su negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda,  haciéndole adecuaciones. Su sueño mas delante de prosperidad,  es ampliar su negocio, mejorar su vivienda y en un futuro tener un buen vehículo.  En la actualidad Rafael está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará hilos en mayor volumen,  para elaborar bolsos, pues necesita responder a pedidos que han hecho sus clientes, lo que garantiza el éxito de su inversión y el aumento gradual de su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Rafael lives in the municipality of San Jacinto, a land characterized by its beautiful hammocks and backpacks woven on vertical looms, a traditional activity in this region of the country.  His home is composed of his spouse and two children who are 2 and 7 years old who he plans to give as much wellbeing as he possibly can working persistently in his business making bags on vertical looms which is how he currently earns income.  However, he believes that he has high growth potential that he hasn’t yet explored and he’s interested in furthering his growth in order to earn more money.

He learned this activity while working in another workshop where he made bags on a loom and when he was trained he went out on his own and launched his dream of starting a business of his own.  With his business he’s managed to support his family and do some home improvements.  His dream for later on is prosperity, to expand the business, improving his home and in future own a good vehicle.

Rafael is currently applying for his first Kiva loan which is also his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he will use to buy thread in larger volume to make bags because he needs to fill pending orders he has from customers which guarantees the success of his investment and the gradual increase of his working capital.

loans.use: to buy thread in large amounts.

loans.name: Cruz Del Pilar

texts.es:
Doña Cruz, continua trabajando en su costura, el cual por años ha ejercido su profesion, captando al cliente por su calidad de trabajo, su esposo trabaja en la misma profesion lo que es de gran apoyo.
Sus trabajo son por encargos, y tambien vende en su casa de habitacion, su produccion ah aumentado al hacer mas costura, lo que gracias a los financiamientos ha sido posible cumplir con la demanda. Con este nuevo prestamo comprara variedad de tela, en sincatex, gabardina, clasitex, seda, zipper, botones, entre tela, bordados, adornos, hilos, elastico y otros productos para seguir haciendo sus vestidos. Y obtener mejores ganancias al vender mas.
texts.en: Cruz continues working sewing, her profession for many years, winning over customers thanks to the quality of her work.  Her husband works in the same profession which is a great support.  She works based on prior orders and also sells from home.  Her production has increased since she’s made more items for thanks to the financing she was able to meet demand.  She will use this new loan to buy a variety of fabric like polyester, gabardine, silk, zippers, buttons, fabric, embroidery, decorations, thread, elastic and other products to continue making gowns and earning better profits by selling more.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela  de 57 años de edad es una mujer viuda que tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 26 a 33 años, ella vive con su familia en San Jacinto, tierra tradicionalmente artesanal, donde se encuentran hermosas artesanías y manualidades, por eso para Graciela no es ajeno esta tradición que data de su familia y ella la practica desde los 11 años de edad cuando aprendió con sus vecinas y familiares este bello arte.  Ella emprendió su idea degenerar ingresos mediante esta actividad y emprendió su negocio vendiendo productos artesanales como bolsos, suvenires, etc.  Pero su principal línea es el bolso. En la actualidad quiere hacer crecer su capital de trabajo pero no alcanza con lo que recoge de su negocio a invertir en mayor volumen, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará hilos e insumos para hacer una buena oferta de nuevos diseños en bolsos que ya tienen encargado cuando hizo su preventa. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su local y continuar apoyando a sus hijos para que logren mucho bienestar y una vida de éxitos.
texts.en:
Graciela, 57, is a widow with four children whose ages range from 26 to 33.  She lives with her family in San Jacinto a land of craftsmen where beautiful crafts and handiwork can be found.  Because of this, this family tradition is not alien to Graciela who has been doing crafts since the age of 11 when she learned this beautiful art from some neighbors and family members.

Her idea to generate income through this activity arose and she started her business selling crafts like bags, souvenirs, etc.  But her main line is purses.  She wants to increase her working capital but what she earns in her business isn’t quite enough to invest in larger volumes and this is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she will use to buy thread and supplies to offer new purse designs that she already has on order through presales.  Her goal for later on is to expand her locale and to continue supporting her children so that they will attain much wellbeing and a life of success.

loans.use: to buy thread and supplies.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Ventura Group

texts.es: Teodora de 60 años de edad es viuda y tiene 6 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de sábanas, toallas, frazadas y otros productos para el hogar. Tiene 4 años en este negocio el cual comenzó con la venta de tazas y platos de plástico con la idea de poder obtener mayores ingresos para poder cubrir sus necesidades de alimentación y pago de servicios. Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar en diferentes casas haciendo limpieza a domicilio. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Actualmente sus ingresos los destina a cubrir los gastos de alimentación y compra de mercadería para su negocio. Su plan para el futuro es abrir un local propio para la venta de sus productos. Usará el crédito en la compra de mercadería. Teodora pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Los Ángeles de Ventura” el cual esta conformado por 6 personas y que le pusieron el nombre debido a que una de las socias del grupo constituyó un colegio en su zona con el mismo nombre.
texts.en:
Teodora, 60, is a widow and has six children.  She sells sheets, towels, blankets and other items for the home.  

She’s been in business four years which she started selling plastic cups and plates with the idea of earning higher income to cover food and utility costs.  She used to work in various houses doing domestic labor.
