She is asking for a loan in order to buy middling (coarsely ground wheat mixed with bran) and concentrate (food pellets) in order to feed the cattle, pigs and chickens. The loan will help her to have enough food at hand in order for things to go well.

Julia’s dream is to improve her farm, expand, and she aspires to have better sales and profits for her family.

loans.use: to buy middling (coarsely ground wheat mixed with bran) and concentrate (food pellets)

loans.name: Khoudia Fall

texts.fr:
Madame Khoudia, célibataire âgée de 35 ans est une technicienne horticole de profession depuis 2003.En plus de cela elle gère un atelier de menuiserie depuis 7 ans. Khoudia est une habituée de la caisse car elle a déjà bénéficié de 4 crédits.
Elle va acheter  pour cette fois 5 tonnes de bois à raison de quatre vingt mille francs la tonne et le transporter à cinquante mille francs.
Khoudia n’a pratiquement pas de charges, ce qui lui permet de s’occuper entièrement de son activité.
Elle travaille toujours dans cette lancée : agrandir davantage son atelier.
texts.en:
Ms. Khoudia, 35 years old and unmarried, has been a horticultural technician by profession since 2003. In addition to this, she has been managing a woodworking shop for seven years. 

Khoudia is a regular customer of this branch office because she has already had four loans. This time, she is going to buy 5 tonnes of wood at 80,000 francs per tonne and to pay 50,000 francs to transport it. 

She has practically nobody to support, so this enables her to look after her business whole-heartedly. She continues to work along these lines:  expanding her workshop further.

loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr:
Madame Anna, ménagère, âgée de 40 ans est marié et mère de famille. Elle habite à environ 2km du guichet mais cela ne l’empêche pas de faire des opérations régulières d’épargnes. Son activité consiste à élever des porcs pour  qu’arrivés à terme, elle revende la viande. Elle a une expérience de 6 ans dans ce domaine.
Avec le crédit elle compte acheter cinq porcs à cinquante milles francs.
Bien qu’étant une femme, cela ne l’empêche pas de participer à la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Elle souhaite élargir son commerce et pouvoir  augmenter sa capacité d’offre.
texts.en:
Ms. Anna, a married housewife and mother, is 40 years old and lives about 2 km from the branch office, but this doesn’t prevent her from making regular savings deposits. Her work involves raising pigs and, at the right time, she sells their meat. She has six years of experience in this domain. 

With this loan, she intends to buy five pigs at a cost of 50,000 francs. Even though she is a woman, this does not prevent her from helping to cover day-to-day household expenses. She would like to expand her business and to be able to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and resell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian de 25 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 7 años de edad, uno de ellos estudia, vive en Barrio la Peña, Puerto Cortes.
Lilian es una persona muy emprendedora, tiene un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas como ser pollo frito con tajadas, chuleta de cerdo con tajadas, churros, refrescos, dulces, jugos, etc. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en un local de la escuela que esta cerca de su casa, al cual le dedica el  tiempo necesario, todos los días. Anteriormente tenia una pulpería donde vendía productos de la canasta básica, pero miro que la venta de la comida le generaba más ganancias y decidió cambiar.
Está solicitando un segundo préstamo, con el actual va invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comida como ser, carnes, plátanos, verduras, jugos, salsas, manteca o aceite, churros, dulces y  refrescos, para ofrecer variedad de productos a los alumnos de la escuela.
Su meta es incrementar las ventas para obtener más ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lilian is 25 years old, married, and has two children (ages 2 and 7). One child is in school. Lilian lives in the neighborhood of La Peña in Puerto Cortes.

She is a very enterprising person. Lilian has a business selling fast food such as fried chicken with plantains, pork chops with plantains, “churros” (strips of fried dough), soft drinks, sweets, juices, and other items. Her business is established at a school near her home and dedicates the time needed every day. Lilian previously owned a store where she sold household products, but she looked at selling food as a way to generate more income. As a result, she decided to make the change.

Lilian is requesting her second loan and will invest in supplies for preparing food such as meats, plantains, vegetables, juices, sauces, lard, oil, dough, candy, and soft drinks so that she can offer a variety of products to the students at the school. Her goal is to increase her sales so that she can generate more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meats, plantains, vegetables, juices, sauces, lard, oil, dough, candy, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yainkain

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Yainkain.  She is single and has one child aged 3 who is not going to school. She has no additional dependents who live with her. 

 In 2004, Yainkain established her cosmetology business. She started doing this work first after she graduated with a diploma in cosmetology. Working 7 days a week and 6 to 7 hours a day, she earns about Le 500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

Yainkain requires a loan in order to improve her business by buying more stock of hairdressing products for her clients. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits to approximately Le 800,000. In the future, Yainkain intends to continue to educate her child from this business  and to improve her salon into a training center for young girls and hope  to be a great business woman.   She is  thanking you for your support.

loans.use: cosmetology

loans.name: Pamela Lisbeth

texts.es: La señora Pamela, tiene su tienda de barrio donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, gaseosas galletas, dulces y variedad de productos de primera necesidad, vive en la zona el recreo en la casa de su madre, su tienda la abre desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las  10 de la noche, hace dos años que se dedica a esta actividad, sus compras las realiza por el centro de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, también estudia por las noches dejando a la venta a cargo de su mama y de su hermana menor, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Pamela comprara gaseosa, azúcar y arroz `para así surtir su tienda,  es una persona responsable la cual tiene muchas aspiraciones hacia el futuro como el de salir profesional  y ejercer su profesión, con esta actividad la Sra. Mantiene sus gastos personales de su familia y también sus gastos de estudio, es muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Pamela has a neighborhood store where she offers basic necessities. She sells groceries, sodas, cookies, candy, and variety of other staples. Pamela lives at her mother’s house in the District of El Recreo. Her store is open from 7am to 10pm. She has been in this business for two years. Pamela purchases her goods in the central part of the city of Santa Cruz. She also studies at night, so she leaves the store under the charge of her mother and younger brother.

With the money from this loan, Sra. Pamela will buy sodas, sugar, and rice to restock her store. She is a responsible person who has many future aspirations of becoming a successful professional in her career. With this business, Pamela is able to keep up with her family’s expenses and the cost of her studies. She is an extremely hard worker who is happy and grateful for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 30 years old. He sells electronics to earn a living.  He has been in the business for five years and has employed one person.  Even though he runs his business in a competitive environment, he is able to retain his customers because of his good services.

John also owns rental houses and he does farming.  He is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has managed to expand his business.  He has requested a loan of 10,900 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp.  He will use the lamp to light his business and his house.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Prince

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Prince. He is married to a businesswoman and has two children aged 10 and 4 years old. In 1990, Prince established his essential drugs business. He began his business because after finishing high school, he joined his family in business in Kono. Since then, he decided not to further his studies and within years, he proved to be a good businessman. Unfortunately, the war broke out and rebels entered Kono. He ran to Makeni with nothing in his pocket. There he started working for friends until he raised some funds to start his own business fresh.  Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,985,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 . Prince has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy panadol - 2 cartons @ Le540,000, eat fine syrup - 2 cartons @ Le500,000, hunger up syrup - 3 cartons @ Le300,000, relief pain tabs - 2 cartons @ Le700,000, and solotone - 2 cartons @ Le310,000. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 497,000 . In the future, Prince plans to open an advance pharmacy.  

He feels good because it is helping organize him. He wants to see his children have a good education.  It wills greatly as it another source of generating income.  Fluctuation in foreign currency is his major problem.  Competition is not great because only two of them are in the same line of business in that area.  He serves patients with prescriptions from hospital and retailers.  He serves about 60 people per day.  His store is licensed and he does not sell illegal drugs. He treats his customers with respect and patience.  His suppliers are located in Freetown where he goes once per week and in Conakry twice a month to buy in large quantity.  He usually goes by public vehicle.  He uses his profit to develop his unfinished building and the rest as an addition to his capital.  A rise in the cost of goods affects him greatly because as cost prices change, he has to change his selling price as it affect his customer buying pattern. He offers quality products. 

He serves people around the city, at least 60 people per day, His business is popular as he treats his customers with respect and fairly   He is assisted by family members.  He buys his goods in Conakry twice per month and in Freetown once every week.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drugs for his pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for his business

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 34 años siempre fue una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada con Lucio de 45 años con quien es madre de un hijo. Dany de 18 años, ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación a su menor hijo. A diario Karina sale muy temprano de su hogar, se dirige a un mercado muy concurrido de la ciudad en donde tiene una pequeño puesto de condimentos o también como se les conoce en la región (especeria) ahí ella prepara diferentes combinaciones de condimentos para poder venderlos a sus fieles clientes que siempre van a comprar, ya que ahí encuentran buen trato, precio justo y sobre todo una regalito de su parte. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 11 años y siempre trabajó sola. Todo lo que realiza en su puesto es muy buena para ella, ya que durante su tiempo trabajando ahí supo ganarse un buen numero de clientes que siempre van a comprarle y eso le genera buenas venta y con lo mismo buenas ganancias, espera seguir trabajando mucho para poder hacer crecer su negocio y con lo mismo su economía. Este será el préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal en donde la quieren mucho por que es muy responsable y solidaria, espera que le puedan brindar el préstamo que será un respaldo para ella y seguir aumentando su negocio, esta convencida que seguirá siendo una socia muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como todos los prestamos que tuvo hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará ingredientes, condimentos y especias para aumentar su variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Karina, age 34, has always been a hardworking woman. She is married to Lucio, age 45, and is the mother of a son named Dany who is 18 years old. Karina works a great deal because she wants to provide her son with a better quality of life and a good education. Every day Karina leaves her house very early and heads toward the busiest market in the city where she has a small stand from which she sells condiments and other spices that are well-known in the region. She prepares different combinations of condiments and sells them to her loyal customers who are always looking to make a purchase. Karina provides good service, fair prices, and above all, a small personal gift. She has been in this line of work for 11 years and has always worked alone. Her vending post has always been good to her. Throughout the time she has been working, she has always been able to attract a good number of customers who are willing to buy. As a result, she has been able to earn a good income. Karina hopes to continue working hard so that she can grow her business and improve her finances.

This will be her eighth loan with the MFP organization. Karina has always been a good member of her communal Bank, where she is greatly admired because of her responsibility and her supportiveness. She hopes to receive a loan as a sign of personal validation so that she can continue growing her business. Karina is determined to continue being a punctual member who submits her payments on time, just as she had with her previous loans. The amount of 1000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy ingredients, condiments, and spices so that she can increase the variety of products that she offers to her customers.

loans.use: to buy various condiments and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy Tapes and DVDs and pay for transportation costs

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has four children, ages 18, 15, 13, and 4. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she is in school. In 2007, Fatmata established her business selling baby items. She began her business because she wants to provide assistance to her husband, and because the business provides solutions to her immediate domestic needs. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid one loan. She now requires a new loan in order to buy Flask, Napkins Baby wrapper, powder and toy mobile phones. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Fatmata plans to transform her stall into an established shop, to assist her husband, and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy flask, Napkins Baby wrapper, powder and toy mobile phones

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, 47, is separated and has two children. She resides at Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Teresita operates a fishing business venture selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for ten years. Each month she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

In 2008, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Mayran  Nallely

texts.es:
La señora Mayran es una señora trabajadora  que se dedica a la venta de a la venta de libros de reflexiones y libro para niños.
Esta felizmente  casada con el señor  Asael un señor trabajador a quien esta orgulloso de su esposa por ser una persona trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante y cumplir todos sus sueños como es tener una librería.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas libros para niños ya que son lo libros que mas rápido se vende .
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayran is a hardworking woman who sells meditation books and children’s books. She is happily married to Sr. Asael, a hardworking gentleman who is proud that his wife in an industrious woman who likes moving forward and fulfilling her dreams of having a bookstore.

Mayran is requesting a loan to buy more children’s books since these items sell very quickly. She is grateful to Fundación Realidad for helping her fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy children's books.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 29 years old and has 2 children. She lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. 

Emelyn owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase more fruits to sell. 

In 2011, Emelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  She hopes for positive business improvements.

loans.use: buy fruits

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a single man who doesn't have any children yet. He describes himself as ambitious. 
Stephen operates a retail store where he sells khat. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a conducive environment. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of khat. Stephen also runs a retail shop to increase his income. 
Stephen will use his loan of 10,000 KES to buy more khat. His business goal is to venture into owning a hardware retail store within five years.

loans.use: to buy more khat for resale.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is from Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 48 years old and is married with one child.  Marcelina owns and operates a business providing general clothing services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Marcelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tools & supplies such as needles & threads. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 60  years old. Juanita is married and has 2 children. 

To make a living, Juanita owns and operates a business venture, making & selling a variety of snack foods in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month from these activities.

Juanita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional snack foods to sell. In 2008, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: buy snack foods to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a single mother of two children living in Hioma, Uganda. She has been running a salon business for five years. She faces a challenge of high price fluctuations and the seasonal nature of the business. Her business goal is to expand her business to new markets and her personal goal is to educate her children. Doreen needs a loan to buy dryers and hair weaves for her salon.

loans.use: to buy dryers and hair weaves for her salon.

loans.name: Rosefely

texts.en:
Rosefely is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 65 years old.  Rosefely is widowed and has 1 child. 

To make a living, Rosefely operates a tailoring business, providing general clothing services to local community members.  She has been engaged in her business for 23 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosefely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosefely is requesting a new loan of 4,800 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: buy fabrics & sewing materials

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is from Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old, married and has five children. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as food for snacks, sardines, candies, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the community. Elvie has been in her business for eight years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. 

In 2009, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 38 years old and is married to Margret. They have children. John has been farming and selling vegetables for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 12000.

John is applying for his first loan with KADET ltd of KES 20,000. He will use the funds to purchase fertilizer seeds and pesticides. With the anticipated profits, he will educate his children.

John's hopes and dreams are to increase his level of output from the farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Oriku Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 24 years old, single, and resides in Narok, Kenya. He is a maize farmer, which he has been doing for the past eight years. He got to know KADET through a registered client with KADET. He has been a good client and this is his fourth loan, which he has planned to use to prepare land for farming and buy farm inputs, i.e. maize seeds and fertilizers.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to re-invest in another business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to prepare his maize farm

loans.name: Pyhilils

texts.en:
Pyhilils is 45 years old a mixed crop farmer, she is married to Simon who is a business man. They are blessed with two children aged 18 and 15 years respectively. She has been in the farming business for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Pyhllis will use the loan to buy seedling and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedling and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a fifty-three-year-old he is married and has seven children. He rears goats and grows flowers in Kangemi. John has been in the business for twenty years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand  shillings.

This will be John’s third loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to buy goats to rear and sale later at a profit and add pots to plant more flowers for sale. 

With the profit that he will get, he wants to diversify in his business.In future he wants to be able to expand his business and sustain his family by improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to boost his wife's grocery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy eggs, soft drinks, baking flour, etc. to add to her stock for sale.

loans.name: Kimanyisho

texts.en:
Kimanyisho is a married woman. She has five children who depend on her. She has been farming for a period of six years.

She knew about KADET LTD through other women registered in her area of residence. She paid the previous loan successfully without complication; this is her fourth loan from KADET LTD, and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizer and to hire manpower to aid in the farm. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standards of her family

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Natilda

texts.en:
Natilda is 46 years old.  She is from Gilgil and is married to James.  Together they have one son who is 17 years old.

Natilda has a retail shop and has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to help her add inventory to her business.  She wants to buy foodstuffs and soft drinks to stock and sell in her shop.

She hopes to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs and soft drinks to add to her inventory to sell.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 39 years old, married and a mother of three children. She operates a salon in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last three years. She earns a monthly profit of 25,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of 45,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to add  inventory of hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes needed for her business. 

She will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her children. In the future, Naomi hopes to grow her salon and also intends to open up a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: To purchase hair weaves, wigs, and hair dyes

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 50 years old and married to Richard. They have five children, ages 28, 24, 18, 14, and 12 years respectively. Everline has been selling herbal medicines, with  monthly income as KES 8,500. 

She has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more stock of assorted herbal medicines for sale. The anticipated amount would be used to repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams are to be a multi-level marketing distributor and to educate her children, as well as to expand her farming.

loans.use: to buy more stock of assorted herbal medicines for sale.

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita is 38 years old and is married with 5 children. 

Janita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business selling feeds and other veterinary products in the Philippines.  She has been running this business for 4 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.  

Janita has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Janita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy more stocks to sell

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 34 years old.  She is married and has 2 children who are in school.

Girlie is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.   She has been raising livestock for 4 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.   She has requested a loan for PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy more livestock to raise and sell.

In the future, Girlie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: buy livestock

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia es una mujer de 34 años de edad que se encuentra casada desde hace 18 años con el señor Rogelio el cual se dedica a hacer trabajos de albañilería, ellos tienen 1 hijo estudiando en 3er año de secundaria y 2 pequeños que aún no estudian.

La señora Patricia es una persona muy trabajadora que en sus tiempos libres se dedica a bordar y a tejer, pero su principal actividad económica es la compra y venta de pollos de engorda. Ella lleva ya 2 años de experiencia en esta actividad en la cual; compra sus pollos con los polleros que pasan por su pueblo ofreciéndocelos o la mayoría de las veces va a las plazas comerciales de su municipio para ahí comprarlos, después los lleva a su casa donde se encarga de cuidarlos. Ya en su casa les hace un pequeño corral o gallinero acondicionado a fin de que ahí puedan comer, dormir y criarse. En el gallinero la señora Patricia les da agua y alimento y se encarga de que no les falte nada.

En esta ocasión la señora Patricia solicita este préstamo para comprar 10 pollos de engorda y alimento, ella es cliente de Frac desde hace ya 5 ciclos, en los cuales se ha visto beneficiada por los préstamos, de una forma radical ya que cada vez lo ha invertido bien y siempre paga puntualmente, cuando ella vende sus pollos lo hace en su casa.
La señora Patricia es una mujer soñadora a la que le gustaría en un futuro comprar más de 100 pollos y poner una granja de pollos y venderlos.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 34-year-old woman. She has been married for 18 years to Rogelio, who works doing masonry projects. They have one child in the third year of secondary school and two little ones who are not in school yet. 

Patricia is a very hard-working person who works at embroidery and weaving in her spare time. However, her main economic activity is buying and selling chickens, which she fattens for sale. She has 2 years of experience with this work. She buys the chickens from dealers who come through her village offering them, or more often she goes to the commercial centers of her town to buy them there. She then takes them to her house where she carefully raises them. She prepares them a little pen or chicken coop, which is arranged so they can eat, sleep and grow there. Patricia gives them water and food in their coop, and she makes sure that they have everything they need. 

On this occasion, Patricia is requesting this loan to buy 10 young chickens and chicken feed. She has been a client of FRAC for 5 loan cycles already, and she has found herself benefited by the loans in a radical way, since each time she has invested them well and has always paid them off punctually. When she sells her chickens, she does so from her house. 

Patricia is a woman who is also a dreamer, and in the future she would like to buy more than 100 chickens, set up a chicken farm and sell them.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bed mat-making business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 5 years.   She also earns income from food vending and running a variety store.  

Angela is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her bed mat-making business.

Angela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and repair her family home in the future.

loans.use: buy mat-making materials

loans.name: Gbenagnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENAGNON est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Nicole est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Nicole est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Nicole n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Nicole est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Laurent. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Nicole vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Nicole vend depuis dix ans environs, des fruits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Nicole sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENAGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group GBENAGNON is comprised of four persons who live in the same district. This is the fourth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their business. The group's representative, named Nicole, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. 

Nicole is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a tailor named Laurent. They have two children, both in school and in their care. She lives together with her husband and children. 

The couple jointy ensure that the diverse family expenses are covered. To do so, Nicole has been selling fruit for about six years at a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her income, Nicole along with the other members of the group GBENAGNON are requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. The first three loans were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 49 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a variety store in the Philippines.  She has been running this store for 5 years and also earns an income from fishing and bed mat-making.  

Delia has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, snack food, soft-drinks and other miscellaneous items to sell.

Delia has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save money to expand her business and renovate her family home.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 3 years now.

Juditha requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing equipment and pay for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

In the future, Juditha would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: buy fishing equipment and maintain her fishing boat

loans.name: Yandé

texts.fr: Madame Yandé est une femme mariée de  39 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle est mère de 5 enfants  qui sont âgés  entre 8 et 23 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce  et la vente de poissons dans la localité ou elle habite au Sénégal. Elle capitalise une expérience de 5 ans dans cette  activité qu’elle a  choisie du fait qu’elle vit dans un village de pécheurs. Par ailleurs c’est le bénéfice qui l’intéresse le plus. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la zone depuis février 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’approvisionnement en poissons destinés  a la vente. Son  souci est de mieux développer son activité en vue d’améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Yandé is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Senegal. She is the mother of five children, who are from 6 to 23 years old. She works in the commercial sector and sells fish in the town where she lives in Senegal. She capitalizes on five years of experience in this business, which she chose because she lives in a fishing village. 

In any case, profit is what she is most interested in. Since February 2011, she has been a member of the U-IMCEC branch office in the area. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for stocking up on fish to sell. She is concerned about developing her business further with the aim of improving her family's social situation.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Gie Dinguiraye Youssoupha 4 Group

texts.fr: Les deux femmes qui constituent le "GIE dinguiraye youssoupha 4" sont mariées et ont des enfants. Elles font le commerce de produits de soins, de toilette et de beauté.Le chef du groupe (en foulard blanc ), est mère de cinq enfants.Elle vend de l'encens et des colliers en perle traditionnelle.Avec les revenus générés par son commerce, elle appuie son mari dans les dépenses d'entretien de la famille et subvient en même temps à ses propres besoins. Le groupe sollicite un pret de 250000f pour acheter des produits de toilette et de beauté..
texts.en:
The two women who comprise the group "GIE dinguiraye youssoupha 4" are married and have children. They trade in personal care products and beauty products. 

The head of the group (in a white scarf) is the mother of five children. She sells incense and traditional beaded necklaces. With the revenues generated by her commerce, she supports her husband in covering family care costs. And at the same time, she supports herself. 

The group is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs to buy bath products and beauty products.

loans.use: to buy bath and beauty products

loans.name: Erenia

texts.en:
Erenia is 44 years old and married with five children. Erenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Erenia has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns income from a tricycle transportation service. Erenia hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Salma Paola

texts.es: Salma de 20 años nació en la ciudad de Barranquilla y terminó sus estudios de bachillerato y formó su familia a la edad de 17 años; ella es una joven mujer que tiene un hijo de 2 años y en compañía de su cónyuge, todos los días se despiertan  dispuestos a trabajar persistentemente, para lograr un futuro mejor, para que  su hijo se convierta en una persona exitosa. Salma inició, desde muy pequeña,  su experiencia en este oficio, pues  aprendió la decoración en icopor y se dedicó a trabajar en ella; hoy tiene un taller desde hace 3 años,  en donde fabrica productos artesanales para papelerías del centro de la ciudad, misceláneas y otros negocios. Su meta más adelante   es tener su propia casa y su mayor desafío es lograr un capital de trabajo suficiente,  para responder a la demanda de su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará materias primas como icopor, pinturas, siliconas, escarchas, en un mayor volumen para disminuir sus costos productivos y ofrecer un mejor precio de venta; con esta inversión aprovecharía que se acercan los carnavales de Barranquilla y estos son los productos que mas se venden en esta temporada. Su éxito radica en el conocimiento de su arte, del mercado y en que con esta inversión dará respuesta a pedidos  que tiene de parte de su clientela rentable,  a la cual siempre planea responder oportunamente.
texts.en:
Salma is 20 years old and was born in the city of Barranquilla.  She completed her bachelor studies and started her family at age 17.  She’s a young woman who’s been with her life’s partner for two years.  Each day they awake, determined to work persistently in order to achieve a better future so that her son can be successful.

Salma began gaining experience, making foam decorations, when she was a young girl and has had a workshop for three years.  She makes crafts for shops and other businesses in the city center.  Her goal is to have her own home in the future, but her greatest challenge is obtaining the necessary capital so that she can respond to her customer demand.  This is the reason she’s requested a Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy foam, paints, silicone, and frost material in quantity.  This investment will allow her to take advantage of the Barranquilla carnivals, which is the time when most of her products sell.  Her success lies in her knowledge of the art, of the market, and knowing that this investment will allow her to make a profit by responding to her customer demand, which she always plans to respond to in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Madame Ndella est une femme de 85 ans qui vit dans un village sénégalais. Elle est veuve et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 40 et 60 ans. C’est une ancienne femme de ménage qui a pris sa retraite et  perçoit  une pension mensuelle. Mais elle  dispose d’  une chambre qu’elle a mis en location et qui lui permet de compléter ses revenus mensuels. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis  octobre 2009. Elle a déjà remboursé un prêt antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour assister une de ses petites filles malade  a prendre en charge son traitement. Ce financement pourra l’aider  a assurer un certain équilibre au sein de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndella is an 86-year-old woman who lives in a Senegalese village. She is a widow and the mother of five children, from 40 to 60 years old. A former housekeeper who is retired, she receives a monthly pension. But she has a room that she rents out, and this enables her to round out her monthly income. 

Since October 2009, she has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch office. She has already repaid a previous loan. 

Ms. Ndella is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to help cover medical treatment costs. This financing can help guarantee some stability in her family.

loans.use: to cover the medical costs of treating her ill granddaughter.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita  es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de pan desde hace tres años.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Crispin un señor trabajador humilde que se dedica al trabajo del campo como es la siembra de maíz para la venta.
Tambien se dedica a la venta de jugos y refrescos por menudeo, sin embargo éste préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de insumos para el pan, ya que es ahi donde necesita invertir.
Tiene la  cantidad de cuatro hijos trabajadores  quienes la poyan por ser una madre trabajadora con deseos de mejor su calidad de vida.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla  para que pueda mejor su calidad de vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita is a hardworking woman who has been selling bread for three years. She is happily married to Sr. Crispin, a hardworking and humble gentleman who has a job in the fields growing corn for sale.

Margarita also sells juices and soft drinks. However, this loan will be used to buy supplies for making bread. This is the reason why she needs to invest.

Margarita has four employed children who support their hardworking mother who wants to improve her quality of life. She is grateful to Fundación Realidad for the assistance that will enable her to improve her quality of life and her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making bread.

loans.name: Niagna Ndiaye

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Niagna est âgée  de 30 ans. Elle habite au Sénégal et évolue depuis plus de cinq ans  dans  le domaine de la coiffure. Elle gère un salon dans le quartier ou elle habite, c’est le lieu ou elle reçoit  ses clients  pour leur faire des tresses ou des coiffures ou meme les habiller  pour les cérémonies de baptême  ou de mariage. Elle  y pratique en meme temps la vente de produits cosmétiques et d’accessoires pour femme. Elle a choisi cette activité par passion et a suivi une formation en coiffure  avant d’ouvrir son salon.  Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus dans son activité ce sont les jolies tresses  qu’elle crée. Elle est sociétaire du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle vit depuis février 2009 et a déjà remboursé 3 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour la confection de blouses destinées a ses élèves coiffeuses et a l’achat de bâches  pour le portail du salon. Ce financement va lui permettre d’améliorer le cadre de son salon  et va susciter   d’avantage  l’attraction de la clientèle, ce qui aura pour conséquence  l’augmentation de ses revenus quotidiens et l’amélioration de sa condition de vie sociale.
texts.en:
Ms. Niagna is 30 years old. She lives in Senegal and has been working in the domain of hairdressing for over five years. She manages a salon in the district where she lives. This is where she receives her customers to do their braids or style their hair, or even their clothing, for baptismal or marital ceremonies. At the same time, she sells cosmetics and women's accessories. She chose this work out of passion and had training in hairdressing before opening her salon. What interests her the most in her business are the pretty braids she creates.

Since February 2009, Ms. Niagna has been an associate of the U-IMCEC branch office in the town where she lives. And she has already repaid three previous loans. 

Ms. Niagna is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs for making smocks for her students training to be hairstylist. The loan is also for buying tarps for her salon's doorway. This financing is going to enable her to improve her salon's and to attract more customers. Consequently, her daily revenues will increase and her social situation will improve.

loans.use: to make smocks for her students and to buy tarps for the entry to her salon.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.es: Bernardita, tiene la edad  de 46 años, está casado,  vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo que son actualmente su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito quiere comprar el tubo y el cable para realizar la instalación. Ella tiene su casa en óptimas condiciones pero la instalación de electricidad la quiere mejor para así evitar algún accidente peligroso con esta. Ella querer darle a su casa una mejor seguridad para evitar incendios o accidentes. Ella quiere darles a sus hijos una casa digna y que siempre puedan contar con ella sin peligro de percances en el futuro y así seguir viviendo en un ambiente familiar de armonía siempre. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Bernardita is 46 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children who are currently her highest priority. She will use this loan to buy tubing and cables needed for installation. Bernardita has a home that provides optimal conditions, but installing electricity will be a major improvement. For this reason, she would like to avoid some type of dangerous accident. She would like to make her home safer by avoiding fires or accidents. Bernardita wants to provide her children with a decent home where they can live free of the risk of mishaps in the future and still continue to have a family atmosphere as always.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. Bernardita has not received any other loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of electricity in her home.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es:
La señora Celedonia es una mujer de 47 años de edad que está casada desde hace 25 años  con el señor Francisco el cual se dedica a hacer trabajos de albañilería, juntos viven en una comunidad mazahua, juntos procrearon a 2 hijos, la mayor de 15 años de edad ya no estudia, y tiene una más de 6 años que va en la primaria.
La actividad que la señora Celedonia es vender artículos de papelería, nos cuenta que al igual que muchas otras personas se ha visto afectada por los constantes aumentos en los precios, y hay temporadas en las que hay pocos clientes, ella es cliente de Frac desde hace ya 5 ciclos en los que se ha visto beneficiada en gran medida por los préstamos a la hora de surtir su papelería.

En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para comprar mercancía como:libretas, mapas, gomas, lapices, colores, lapiceros, sacapuntas, juegos geométricos, y cartulinas para tener mejor surtida su tienda (papelería).
Cada vez que la señora Celedonia recibe su préstamo, va a su centro municipal a surtirse de toda esta mercancía a un precio económico para que a ella le convenga venderla en su pueblo y saque lo que invirtió, el local donde ella está instalada es propio, y le gustaría hacerlo más grande.

La señora Celedonia sabe que este crédito le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y sabe que es capaz de superar las dificultades que se le puedan presentar como falta de clientes, incremento en los precios, etc. ella sabe que con el crédito podrá hacer crecer su negocio con el que lleva ya 2 años y darle una mejor vida  a su familia.
texts.en:
Celedonia, 47, has been married to Francisco for 25 years. He works as a mason, and they live together in the community of Mazahua. They have 2 children - the oldest is 15 and no longer in school, and the younger daughter is 6 and in primary school. 

Celedonia sells stationary products. She says that like many other people, she has been affected by constant price increases, and there are seasons when she doesn't have many customers. She has been a client of Frac for 5 cycles now and has seen great benefits, in large part due to the loans at times when she needed to stock her stationary store.

On this occasion she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to stock her store, like notebooks, maps, erasers, pencils, colored pencils, pencil cases, pencil sharpeners, games, graph paper and poster board. Every time that she gets a loan, she goes to town to stock up on merchandise at an affordable price so that she can sell it in her town and make her money back. She owns her store, and would like to make it larger.

Celedonia knows that this loan will help her to improve her sales and she knows that she's capable of overcoming the challenges that present themselves, like a lack of customers, price increases, etc. She knows that with this loan she will be able to grow her two-year-old business and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy stationary products to sell.

loans.name: Maria Cleofas

texts.es:
La  señora Maria Cleofás es una señora  humilde  de cincuenta y  nueve años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace nueve años.
Esta felizmente casada  con el señor Celestino un señor trabajador y humilde.
Tiene la cantidad de dos hijos pero ya están felizmente casados.
Ella pidió el préstamo para  la compra de más pescado para la venta por mayoreo y menudeo.
texts.en:
Maria Cleofás, 59, is a humble woman who has been selling fish for 9 years. She is happily married to Celestino, a hardworking and humble man. She has two children who are both happily married. 

She asked for a loan to buy more fish to sell in bulk and individually.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Laura  Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Laura catalina es una señora trabajadora  que se dedica a la venta de dulces  y a la venta de chicharrones desde hace dos años .
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Francisco  Javier un señor trabajador quien la apoya en todo lo que necesite.
Tiene la cantidad de dos hijos quienes son el motivo por el cual trabaja día a día.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra  de mas dulces para la venta.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla a seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Laura Catalina is a hardworking woman who has been selling candy and fried pork rinds for two years. She is happily married to Sr. Francisco Javier, a hardworking gentleman who supports her in everything as needed. Laura has two children who serve as her reason for working day after day.

She is requesting a loan to buy more candy to sell. Laura is grateful to Fundación Realidad for helping her continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy candy and fried pork rinds.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
La  señora  Estela tiene  treinta y tres años de edad, esta  felizmente  casada con  el señor  Gerardo un señor trabajador muy humilde.
Tiene la cantidad de  dos  hijos  a quienes quiere y por quien trabaja ya que desea darles lo mejor para que tengan un mejor futuro.
Ella se dedica a la venta de calzado por catalogo ya que es buen negocio y le deja buenas ganancias y así obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más calzado y catalogo para la venta.
texts.en:
Estela, 33, is happily married to Gerardo, a very humble and hardworking man. They have two children who they love and for whom they work, because they want to give them the best so they can have a better future. 

She sells shoes from a catalog because it's a good business and she makes good profits, which will allow her a better quality of life. She asked for a loan to buy more shoes and catalogs to sell.

loans.use: to sell shoes by catalog.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
La señora Elva tiene  sesenta y un años de edad, es una señora humilde  trabajadora  y humilde se dedica a la venta  de antojitos mexicanos como son: enchiladas, entomatadas, tostadas, tacos dorados y quesadillas.
Tiene la cantidad de dos hijos es madre soltera pero gracias a su negocio a podido  darle una mejor vida a sus hijos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ingredientes como son: chile verde, Chile seco, cebolla, queso, tomate y maíz para la elaboración de tortillas.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por su apoyo que le ha dando.
texts.en:
Elva, 61, is a humble and hardworking woman who sells Mexican dishes like enchiladas, entomatadas, tostadas, tacos dorados and quesadillas.

She is a single mother of 2 children, and thanks to her business she has been able to give them a better life.

She asked for a loan to buy more ingredients like green chile, dried chiles, onion, cheese, tomato and corn to make tortillas. She is thankful for the support the foundation has given her.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Bonfilia

texts.es:
La señora Bonfilia  es una señora trabajadora  de cincuenta y tres años de edad, se dedica a la venta de  frutas y verduras.
Ella nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es limpiar sus verduras y darles un buen servicio a sus clientes.
También se dedica a limpiar  tamarindos para la elaboración de pulpas.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más frutas y verduras para la venta.
texts.en:
Bonfilia, 53, is a hardworking woman who sells fruits and vegetables. She tells us that what she likes most about her business is cleaning the vegetables and providing good customer service. She also shucks tamarinds to make pulp. 

She asked for a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el sitio Santa Martha de la  parroquia Riochico en Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Querer Es Poder De Riochico. Este lugar se lo conoce por su  vegetación donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María, tiene 45 años  de edad, es madre soltera de tres  hijos dos de los mismos que ya son mayores de edad y el menor de 17 años que es quien vive con ella. Ella aprendió hace varios años corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
 
La señora María tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa en el cual se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa,  trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y en temporadas también elabora uniformes para instituciones, escuelas y colegios de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, con ella laboran dos operarias a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal. Lleva más de 12 años con su negocio y gracias a Dios nunca le falta el trabajo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The members of the "Querer es Poder de Riochico" communal bank meet every two weeks in Santa Martha, in Riochico parish, in Portoviejo. This place is known for its vegetation, and the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture.

This is where we met Maria. She is 45, and a single mother with three children; two of whom are already adults. The youngest, 17, lives with her. She learned dressmaking several years ago in a local academy.
 
Maria has a small sewing workshop in her home, where she makes all types of clothing.  She works based on orders from private individuals, and at certain seasons also makes uniforms for institutions, schools, and high schools in the area.

She works every day from 6:00am to 10:00pm, and sometimes later when she has orders to deliver. Two seamstresses work with her, to whom she pays a weekly salary.  She has been in her business for 12 years, and fortunately she never lacks work.

She is going to use this new loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing materials. She has been in the communal bank for two loan cycles, and she likes it because of the help they provide with the loans. Her dream is to have a large workshop and to keep moving forward.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Zulma es una señora trabajadora   de cuarenta y un años de edad, se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como son: enchiladas, entomatadas  y tacos dorados.
Esta felizmente casada  con el señor Felipe un  señor humilde y trabajador  que se dedica a la albañilería.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra  de mas ingredientes como  es: chile verde, Chile secos, tomate, cebolla y quesos.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que le ha dado para que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Zulma is a hardworking woman who is forty-one years old. She makes a living selling traditional, corn-based Mexican dishes like enchiladas, entomatadas, and tacos dorados.

She is happily married to Felipe, a humble and hardworking man who makes a living doing brickwork.

She asked for the loan to buy more ingredients like: green chile, dried chile, tomato, onion, and cheese.

She is thankful for the support that the foundation has given her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
En el sitio Santa Martha de la  parroquia Riochico en Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Querer Es Poder De Riochico. Este lugar se lo conoce por su  vegetación donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora Maria, tiene 44 años, está separada de su esposo pero de esa relación tuvo  tiene cinco hijos, cuatro mayores y el menor de 17 años de edad que estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven en su casa.

Ella se dedica a diversas actividades para sacar adelante a sus hijos, pues su marido la dejo cuando sus hijos estaban aun pequeños y desde allí tuvo que valerse por sí misma para sacarlos adelante y que nada les faltara nada. Se dedica hasta la actualidad a la venta de productos de bazar y también vende comida, trabaja todos los días en la venta de comida pues prepara desayunos y almuerzos su especialidad es la venta de tongas, que es un plato de arroz con gallina criolla envuelto en hojas de plátano lo cual es muy apetecido por sus clientes. La venta de los productos de bazar los realiza en su casa o si no sale a vender puerta a puerta, lleva más de 15 años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar productos de bazar para la venta y víveres  para preparar los alimentos. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The members of the "Querer es Poder de Riochico" communal bank meet every two weeks in Santa Martha, in Riochico parish, in Portoviejo. This place is known for its vegetation, and the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture.

Maria, who is 44, lives here.  She is separated from her husband, but has five children; four adults, and a minor of 17 who attends high school. Two of her children still live in her home.

She works in a variety of activities to raise her children, as her husband left her when her children were still small. Since then, she has had to fend for herself to bring them up, so that they lacked for nothing.

Up to now she has worked selling school supplies and also food. She works every day selling food as she prepares breakfasts and lunches. Her specialty is selling tongas, which is a dish of rice with free-range chicken, wrapped in plantain leaves, which is very well-liked by her customers.   

She also sells school supplies in her home, or if not, goes out to sell door to door. She has worked at this livelihood for 15 years, and it has gone very well.  

She is going to use the loan to buy stationery to sell, and supplies for making food.

She has been in the communal bank for two loan cycles, and she likes it because of how quickly the loans are issued. 

Her dream is for her children to lack for nothing.

loans.use: To buy food supplies and stationery.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La señora Gumercinda es una señora muy amable  de treinta y ocho años de edad, se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como son: enchiladas verdes, empanadas de pollo y quesillo.
Tambien se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos de la marca avon.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Carlos un señor trabajador y amable con quien tiene dos hijos por quine trabaja para que estén orgullosos de ella.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes como es: chile verde, tomate, cebolla, quesos y maíz para la elaboración de tortillas.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que le ha dado.
texts.en:
Gumercinda, thirty-eight years old, is a very kind woman. She makes a living selling traditional corn-based Mexican dishes like green enchiladas, and chicken and cheese empanadas.

She also makes a living selling Avon cosmetics.

She is happily married to Carlos, a kind and hardworking man with whom she has two children. She works so that her children will be proud of her.

She requested the loan to buy ingredients like green chiles, tomatoes, onions, cheese, and corn to make tortillas.

She thanks the foundation for the support they've given her.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
La señora Florinda  es una señora trabajadora  de setenta y cuatro años de edad, se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos desde hace dos años.
Tambien se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace dos años.
Es viuda  tiene un hijo  por quien decidió tener un negocio ya que desea que termine sus estudios.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ingredientes  como son: chile verde, Chile seco, tomate, cebolla y maíz para la elaboración de tortillas.
Le da las gracias a fundacion por ayudar a las mujeres que son padre y madre para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Florinda, seventy-four years old, is a hardworking woman. She has made a living selling traditional corn-based Mexican dishes for two years.

She has also been making a living selling fish for two years.

She is a widow and has a son. Because of him she decided to begin a business as she wishes for him to finish his studies.

She requested the loan to buy more ingredients to make tortillas like: green chile, dried chile, tomato, onion, and corn.

She is thankful to the foundation for helping women that are both the father and mother of their children.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La señora  Leonor  tiene sesenta y dos años de edad, se dedica a la venta  de pollo  y pescado desde hace   siete años de edad.
También se dedica a la venta abarrotes como es: café, azucar, leche y pan.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas mercancia de abarrotes .
Le da las gracias a fundacion por el apoyo que le ha dado para que  pueda seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonor is 62, and has been selling chicken and fish since the age of seven. She also sells groceries such as coffee, sugar, milk, and bread.

She asked for a loan to buy more grocery merchandise. She gives thanks to the Foundation for the support it has given her, enabling her to continue with her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina tiene sesenta y dos años de edad se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos  desde hace un año.
Tiene un hijo por quien trabaja para darle un mejor futuro  y este orgulloso del gran esfuerzo que hace para ofrecerle una mejor vida.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para la compra  de ingredientes  como es: tomate, cebolla, chile verde, chile seco  y quesos.
texts.en:
Cristina is sixty-two years old. She has been making a living selling traditional corn-based Mexican dishes for one year.

She has son for whom she works to give a better future to, and is proud of the great effort that she makes to give him a better life.

She asked for the loan to buy ingredients like: tomato, onion, green chile, dried chile, and cheese.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: El Volcan De Tetela Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama El Volcán de Tétela está conformado por la señora Olegaria va a comprar con su préstamo aguacate, la señora Gloria va a comprar estambre, telas, cuadrille, mantas, hilos, la señora Emelia va a comprar leche y crema, la señora Elizabeth va a comprar catálogos y zapatos, la señora Diana Lizet va a comprar pantaletas, blusas, catálogos. La señora Diana Lizet tiene 24 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo, ellos tiene dos hijos varones uno estudia la primaria y el otro está en preescolar, ella vende ropa interior por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar brasier, blusas, pijamas  pantaletas, vikinis, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años por invitación de su tía su esposo le dio para comprar surtir sus primeros pedidos, su negocio es importante porque le proporciona ganancias para sus hijos, ella se siente orgullosa  de poder comprar cosas para su casa por ella misma, ella sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa, le gusta convivir con las personas, ella está contenta con su préstamo que va a recibir va a comprar ropa interior para surtir sus pedidos, sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir creciendo con su negocio tener un local para exhibir sus productos y que sus hijos estén bien y no les pasen necesidades. Ellas quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por sus préstamos. Por apoyarnos a crecer nuestros negocios”.
texts.en: This supportive group is called El Volcán de Tétela. It's made up of: Olegaria, who is going to buy avocado with her loan; Gloria, who is going to buy yarn, fabric, gingham, blankets, and thread; Emelia, who is going to buy milk and cream; Elizabeth, who is going to buy catalogs and shoes; and Diana Lizet, who is going to buy panties, blouses, and catalogs. Diana Lizet is 24 years-old and lives in a common law marriage with her husband. They have two boys and one is in elementary school and the other is in preschool. She sells catalog underwear and asked for the loan to buy bras, blouses, pajamas, panties, and bikinis. She began her business four years ago by means of an invitation from her aunt. Her husband supplied her to buy her first orders. Her business is important because it gives her earnings for her children and she is proud to be able to buy things for her home herself. She goes out to offer her products from house to house and she likes to spend time with others. She is happy with her loan that she will receive. She will buy underwear to supply her orders. Her hopes and dreams are for her business to continue growing, to have a shop to display her products in, and for her children to be well and to not lack anything. The women want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you very much for your loans and for supporting us in growing our business."

loans.use: to buy bras, blouses, pajamas, panties, and bikinis.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana es una joven de 22 años y vive con su familia, en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.El turismo es grande en esta zona, más que todo por las hermosas playas de esta provincia.

Desde hace algunos meses atrás Susana, se dedica a la secretaria de esta Empresa de crédito comunal, por esta razón es que necesita de estos elementos de oficina para poder brindar a los clientes y socios un mejor servicio.

Por este motivo Susana está solicitando 200,000.00 (doscientos mil colones), para la compra de un archivero e impresora multifuncional para la Empresa, para el bienestar y buen servicio para los socios.

Susana es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Florida S.A, una de las más de 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA. Este será su primer préstamo con la empresa y  con el espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Susana is a 22-year-old young woman.  She lives with her family in a community in the southern part of Costa Rica, located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on farming activities, with an emphasis on tubers, coffee, corn, beans, and livestock.  Tourism is extensive in this region, especially near the pretty beaches of this province.

Susana has worked as the secretary of this community credit enterprise for a few months.  For this reason she needs these office supplies to be able to offer the clients and members better service.

This is why Susana is requesting 200,000.00 CRC (two hundred thousand colones) to buy a filing cabinet and multifunction printer for the business, for the well-being and good service of the members.

Susana is a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal Florida S.A., one of the more than 150 member organizations of EDESA.  This will be her first loan with the company and with it she hopes to continue growing personally and economically, as well as participate actively in her community's credit organization.

loans.use: to buy office equipment.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La señora Mariela es una  mujer de 25 años de edad que está casada con el señor Ramón, el cual se dedica a hacer trabajos de plomería. Cuando Mariela era pequeña no tuvo muchas oportunidades en cuanto a la educación  por lo que sólo terminó de  estudiar la primaria, juntos Mariela y su esposo tienen a dos hijos que actualmente están estudiando la primaria, uno en quinto y el otro en primero.	
La actividad económica de la  señora Mariela consiste en la compra y venta de ropa a crédito, ella pide el préstamo para surtirse de mercancía en una ciudad del Estado de México, va por ropa los días viernes de cada semana,  el proceso que ella realiza es tomar pedidos, posteriormente va por la ropa a la ciudad, luego se las entrega a sus clientes, los cuales acuerdan pagar a una determinada fecha, y ella va a cobrarles cada 8 días.
Ahora ella solicitó su crédito para comprar; chamarras, faldas, blusas, playeras, suéteres y demás prendas, ella tiene ya 6 años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio y dice que uno de los problemas que han afectado su negocio son los constantes incrementos en los precios.
A la señora Mariela le gustaría en un futuro poner su propio local para vender la ropa y así evitar andar por las calles, esto le beneficiaría de mucho ya que tendría un puesto establecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariela is a 25 year old woman that is married to Mr. Ramón, he works as a plumber. When Mariela was a young girl she did not have many opportunities to get an education and only completed her elementary school studies. Mariela and her husband have two children who are in elementary school one is a fifth grader and the other is a first grader.

Mrs. Mariela works buying and selling clothing on credit. She needs the loan to increase her merchandize which she buys every Friday in México City. She takes clothing orders and buys them in the City and later delivers the items to her customers who agree to pay her on a set date, she collects every week.

Mrs. Mariela needs a loan to buy jackets, skirts, blouses, shirts, sweaters and other items of clothing. She has 6 years of experience in her business and says that one of the problems that her business faces is the constant price increases.

Mrs. Mariela in the future would like to have her own store to sell clothing, this will save her trips and allow her to settle down and have her own store.

loans.use: buy clothing.

loans.name: Harmin Eliseo

texts.es:
Harmin, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y crianza de ganado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, él se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, lo aprendió por su padre, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para el pago del arrendamiento del terreno donde cultivara en esta época, este préstamo será su ayuda para asegurarse que si sembrara en esta temporada.
La aspiración de Harmin es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y alimentación, viendo la manera de salir a delante.
texts.en:
Harmin makes a living growing corn and beans, and raising livestock. He lives with his wife and two children who are 8 and 3 years-old. He has been making a living doing this for ten years, and learned it from his father. He works everyday from 6:00am to 3:00pm.

He is currently requesting a loan to pay for leasing the land he will cultivate this season. The loan will help assure him that he will plant this season.

Harmin's aspiration is to support his children in their studies and in providing them with food, seeing it as the way to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for leasing the land he will cultivate.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
La señora María es una mujer viuda de 46 años de edad, que vive en una comunidad mazahua al norte del estado de México, vive con su hija y la familia de su hija, que son su pequeña hija de 2 años y su yerno. La señora María comenta que ella nunca tuvo oportunidades de estudiar, no sabe leer, ni escribir, pero es muy trabajadora.
La actividad que la señora María realiza con tanto esmero es la crianza de borregos para la venta, además de que se dedica a las labores de su hogar como son, el aseo de su casa, cocinar. La crianza de borregas la hace sin descuidar sus actividades ya que dice que por la mañana muy temprano cuando ella se levanta saca a sus animales a pastar a un lugar verde y los amarra, les da agua, y las cuida, las cambia a la orilla del río, y se va a hacer sus quehaceres ya en el transcurso del día vuelve a ver a sus borregos y les da zacate molido y los cambia de lugar.
Ella es cliente de FRAC desde hace ya 5 ciclos, en los que se ha visto muy beneficiada por los préstamos que le otorga la fundación. 
Ella solicita en esta ocasión el préstamo para comprar 3 borregos y criarlos para posteriormente venderlos. La señora María va por sus animales al centro municipal y los lleva hasta su comunidad donde los cría hasta que han crecido lo suficiente, después las personas que hacen barbacoa la buscan y hacen negocio, es así como la señora María hace su actividad, en la cual lleva ya 3 años.
En un futuro le gustaría comprar aún más borregos y seguirlos vendiendo porque de ahí obtiene su sustento.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a 46 year old widow who lives in the northern part of the state of México in a Mazahua (indigenous people of Mexico) community. She lives with her daughter and her daughter’s family, her 2 year old granddaughter and son-in-law. Mrs. María says that she never had any opportunities to get an education, she doesn’t know how to read or write but she is a very hard worker.

Mrs. María works breeding lambs to sell, she is also a housewife and works cleaning and cooking in her home. Breeding lambs is work that she does independently of her household activities since she wakes up very early in the morning to let the lambs graze in a green area, she ties them up, gives them water and cares for them. Mrs. María also moves them around to the shore and goes home to do chores that she does throughout the day and in the afternoon she goes back to her lambs and gives them ground grass and moves them to another place.

Mrs. María has been a member of FRAC for 5 loan cycles and has benefited from the loans that were granted by the foundation.

She needs a loan to buy 3 lambs, so that she can look after them and sell later on. Mrs. María buys her animals in the city center and takes them to her neighborhood where she cares for them until they have grown enough and people who barbeque the lambs seek her out and they do business. This is how Mrs. María makes her living; she has been doing this for 3 years.

In the future Mrs. María would like to buy more lambs and keep selling them since this is how she makes the money needed to support herself.

loans.use: buy 3 lambs to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 42 years old, married and has six children. He is married to Susan, a housewife. Three of his children attend school. He is a farmer planting rice as a source of income. He usually earns about P10,000 each harvest season in April and November.

He would like to make improvements on his crop production so he is asking for a loan for P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides used in farming.

Hopefully, he would like to have a good harvest to make his family live fortunately.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is a proud farmer living in Afusing Daga. She is married to a farmer which is why their primary source of income comes from farming. They have been planting rice for almost three years. She would like to improve her business so she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow.

In the future, She would like to make her crop more productive so that she could provide an improved life to her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 35 years old, married and has two children. She was engaged in an early marriage and did not seek employment that is why she and her husband are only involved in rice farming. They plant and harvest rice to sell and are able to provide sustenance for the family. 

She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. 

Someday, she would like to achieve a plentiful harvest to earn money and finance the college education of her children to earn a degree.
