loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Patricio

texts.en:
Patricio is a hard working father who raises his family in a village. He is 36 years old and has four school-age children. He earns income through farming. He cultivates their farm lots by planting fruits, vegetables and root crops for sale. He aims to become financially stable to provide his family's needs and to support the education of their children. In this regard, he plans to expand his plantation for vegetables and root crops to ensure a high production.

To work out his plan, he wants to ask for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed for vegetable production. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will be successful in carrying out his plans. He is hoping that he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is married to Leonardo, who is a farmer in their village. The couple have five children. To support the family, they patiently plant and harvest rice to sell. They have a yield twice a year during the months of April and November. As of now, they have insufficient funds to sustain their rice field, so Delia is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. In the future, Delia would like to earn consistent profits to make her family financially stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is a responsible housewife who helps her husband in managing their farm lots by planting fruits, vegetables, and root crops for sale. They have been farmers for almost eighteen years. They aim to increase their yields and income to satisfy their necessities and finance the schooling of their two children. Despite financial difficulty, they have the determination to uplift their status of living and give their children a better life. 

To increase their income, Olivia is asking for additional capital of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable production. She believes that this loan will help them to increase their vegetable production and hopes that they will become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable production.

loans.name: Nelita

texts.en:
Nelita is 55 years old and has six children. Only one of them is in school. She is widowed and involved in rice farming as a source of her income. She had been doing this for seventeen years. To add to her income, she also raises hogs for future sale. She is a patient mother and does all she can in order to provide sustenance for the family.

She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to use in farming.

In the future, Nelita would like to earn consistent profits so that she can save funds for unexpected expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer. He started to plant rice when he was only 20 years old. He inherited a hectare rice field and farming practices from his father, who is a farmer, too. He usually earns a yield twice a year, and the income serves as the sustenance of his family.

Joseph is now 49 years old, married and has four children. Two of his children attend high school and college. He is now asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy UREA (a fertilizer) and seeds.

In the future, Joseph hopes to earn consistent profits to support the education of his children and assure a brighter future for them.

loans.use: to buy UREA (a fertilizer) and seeds.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
At her age of 41, Jean is still single. She lives with her parents at Jurisdiccion, Amulung. Her parents are too old to do farming activities so Jean involves herself in this field of work to provide sustenance for the family. She also hires laborers to help her do farming activities. She has been in the farming business for almost 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (P) each harvest season of April and November.

She would like to improve her income, but she has insufficient funds, so she is now asking for the loan of P10,000 to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor to use in farming.

In the future, she would like to save funds for future expenses, especially since her parents are getting weak and old.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor to use in farming.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta and her husband raised their family in a village. She is 51 years of age and has five children. To earn a living, she helps her husband in managing their farm lots buy planting citrus, corn and root crops for sale. They have been farmers for almost 38 years and usually earn a profit of PHP 23,000 in every harvest season. They usually spend their income for their food and the allowances of their children in school. They endure the problems and hardships in farming to support the education of their children. Being responsible parents, they educate most of their children. 

At this time, they plan to improve their citrus plantation to ensure a good harvest and earn income to satisfy their necessities and save for future emergencies. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of their citrus plantation. She believes that this loan will be a great help for them to work out their plan and hopes that they will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of their citrus plantation

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina has been running her hog raising business for almost 15 years. She is 55 years of age and married to a farmer. The couple was blessed with three children. Josefina's youngest daughter is still in high school while her other two children have their own families already.

Josefina would like to increase her income due to the many expenses in their rice farming, hog raising, household, school fees, and allowances of her youngest daughter. According to her, the income generated from her hog raising business is no longer sufficient to cover all their expenses. So, with this in mind, she is asking for additional working capital amounting to P20,000 which will be utilized to buy feeds and vaccines for the hogs. She believes that her efforts, patience, and wise use of the loan amount will give her a good chance to obtain greater profit which will enable her to improve their living condition.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vaccines for raising hogs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 36 years old and married to a farmer. They are gifted with four children, and they live happily in a village. To earn a living, Marilyn helps her husband in planting vegetables and root crops for sale. Often, they have encountered problems and difficulties in managing their farm due to typhoons and floods. However, through their strong faith and determination, they now seek to expand their planting of root crops.

Due to inadequate capital, Marilyn is asking for additional capital of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay the labor costs required for root crop production. They believe that they will increase their yield and income if they continue to work harder and strive to succeed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides and to pay the labor costs required for root crop production.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 53 years old and has been blessed with seven children. She is a widower. Her husband died in the year 2000 due to cardiac arrest. Despite her marital status, she still does her best in order to raise her seven children. She stands as both the father and mother to her family.

Josefina offers home-based services, particularly manicure, pedicure, hair rebonding, and hair coloring within the village where she lives. 

One of her children has been settled for marriage, separately living with her family. Three of the children are her helpers in providing for the needs of her family, since they are already working. Josefina spends her income on her two children who are still studying. The other child is not studying due to the shortage of finances. 

In this situation, Josefina doesn't have enough capital to buy medicine for hair treatment, nail polish, and other materials needed in her beauty salon business. With this regard, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She hopes that her patience and perseverance will lead her to achieve her goals in business so that she can support her children in their studies. 

Josefina knows that she could improve her family’s financial stability and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for hair treatment, nail polish, and other materials needed in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta, 35, is the mother of three children. Restituta has three years of experience raising pigs, an activity that allows her to raise all her children. As she said, the most tiresome part of raising hogs is cleaning the piggery house every day. But she is determined to work hard to lift her family from poor living. 

Restituta is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and vaccine for her pigs. She dreams of seeing her business grow and having a good estate to leave her children with good economic stability and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for her pigs

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.en: Buying and selling seafood is the primary source of income for Dionicia, a mother of three school-aged children. She has had her business for over two years, earning PHP 5,000 per week. According to her, with the income she generates from her business, she is able to provide their daily meals and continuously send her children to school. Dionicia wanted to further develop her business, which is why she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase seafood such as shrimp and yellow fin to sell.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to sell

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline, 41, is the mother of three children. Angeline has three years experience raising pigs, an activity that allows her to raise all her children. As she said, the most tiresome part of raising hogs is cleaning the piggery house every day. But she is determined to work hard to lift her family from poor living. 

Angeline is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed and vaccine for her pigs. She dreams of seeing her business grow and having a good estate to leave her children with good economic stability and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for her pigs

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Marina is an industrious mother who has great ambition for her family. She is 23 years old and is married to a farmer. They plan to increase their yields and income to acquire their necessities and save for their future. Despite the hardships in farming, they have the strong determination to uplift their status of living.

They aim to plant more vegetables to increase their yields, but due to insufficient capital, Marina is asking for additional capital of 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of vegetable production. They mentioned that their patience and hard work will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for the maintenance of her vegetable production.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
To generate income, Florence and her husband plan to expand their vegetable plantation to ensure a high yield. They cultivate their farm by planting squash and root crops for sale. They aim to increase their yield and income to acquire their basic necessities and save for their future. 

Due to insufficient capital, Florence is asking for additional capital of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for vegetable production. They mentioned that this loan will be a great help for them to work out their plans. They are hoping that they will have a fruitful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for vegetable production.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara has been engaged in her sari-sari store for five years. She is married to Orlando, a construction worker in the village where they are living. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children. Clara wants to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase groceries such as canned goods, noodles, curls, and other kitchen ingredients to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as canned goods, noodles, curls, and other kitchen ingredients

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a devoted wife to Ernesto who is a farmer in their village. They have three children and have been in the farming business for 20 years. Corazon and Ernesto became farmers because it was the only opportunity for them since they only finished high school and do not have further education.
 
Their goal in life is to provide a good education for their three children and get them through college. She is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides to use in farming. She hopes this loan will help improve her crop production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and pesticides to improve crop production.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina and her husband want to improve their root crop production to increase their yields and income, in order to support the education of their three children in college. Due to the high cost of school fees and transportation, they need to earn more to provide all their school needs. 

Marina is asking for a loan of PHP15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to help them to expand their root crop production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed to improve root crop production.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to earn a living. She is 44 years old, married and has been blessed with two children. Nowadays, she only spends her income for her youngest child since her eldest got married already. Her husband has been planting rice crops on her 8,000 square meters of rice field. According to her, she settled for marriage at the age of 21.

Juanita has been engaged in her hog-raising business for 10 years, and she raised one sow that is about to give birth. She also wakes up early in the morning and starts selling native cakes at 5:00, and she is able to finish her vending activity at 6:00 in the afternoon. She has been doing all of these things to increase her profit to allow her to educate her youngest child.

Because of the many expenses of her family, Juanita is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos. She hopes that she can obtain the requested loan amount so that she can buy feed supplies for her raised hogs. Juanita really enjoys her daily routine in business. She knows that this will help her to gain greater income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her hogs.

loans.name: Janelyn

texts.en:
Rice farming is the business that Janelyn and her husband are involved in. They have been in this business for 20 years. She is very thankful that her income from the farming business serves for the family's sustenance: for meals, bills at home and allowances of her three children. With her husband, they patiently plant and harvest rice to meet all of their needs. As of now, she has insufficient funds so she is asking for this loan. She is asking for P10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

In the future, Janelyn would like to keep growing rice so that someday she can make improvements to her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 42 years old and married to Cayetano. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with three children. One of the children is still studying. To make a living, Nora is engaged in a hog-raising business. She had been in this business for 10 years. She usually earns PHP 7,500 per head. 

As she said, her income is not enough to cover their daily household expenses due to the high cost of basic commodities. Thus, Nora wants to borrow a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase feed, vaccine and additional hogs to raise. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested. She is promising to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccine and additional hogs to raise

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is a responsible house wife. She is 34 years old and has three school age children. With her husband, they aim to improve their status of living and educate all of their children. 

Olga is engaged in a business raising hogs to generate additional income. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Olga wants to improve her hog business to earn a higher income.

To improve her business, Olga is asking for an additional capital of P30,000 to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the maintenance of her business. She believes that when she works harder, she will improve and expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for the maintenance of her hog business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 41 years old and married to a farmer. Rosemarie is also involved in this kind of business and helps her spouse do farming activities such as planting and harvesting rice for sale. With their income in this business, they provide school expenses, especially the daily allowances of her three children. 

Rosemarie hopes to improve her output of rice production so she is asking for a loan to help achieve her goal. She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough funds to use for the college education of her children. She would like to provide a better education for them.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 49 years of age, married and has five children. 

He operates a farming business. Daily he goes in to the field just to make sure that his business is always in good hands. He has been in his business for over 15 years and earns P10,000 each crop season. He wants to exceed his previous income, and to grant his wish, he is asking for a loan of P12,000 to buy fuel for the tractor he uses to plow land, and to buy farm inputs such as seeds, insecticides and fertilizers use in his farm land.

He gained financial services to help improve his business as well as his living situation. And the additional revenue generated from his business by next crop season will be utilized for the education of his children and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fuel for the tractor he uses to plow land, and to buy farm inputs such as seeds, insecticides and fertilizers use in his farm land.

loans.name: Appolinaire

texts.fr:
Appolinaire fait le commerce de boutique. Il a 43 ans, marié et a 2 enfants. Ses enfants dont le plus petit a 2 ans et le plus grand a 4 ans, aucun d'entre eux ne va à l'école. Monsieur Appolinaire a 2 personnes en charge.
C'est le 1èr cycle que Monsieur Appolinaire fait avec ACB Ltd. Il veut utiliser le crédit en augmentant la quantité du sucre, riz, du sel qu'il vend dans sa boutique.
Monsieur Appolinaire fera son mieux pour connaitre de plus en plus le gout de ses clients, ce qui lui permettra de leur satisfaire sensiblement.
Avec le profit, il compte aggrandir ses activités commerciales et promouvoir le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Appolinaire is a shopkeeper. He is 43 years old, married and has two children. The youngest is 2 and the oldest is 4, so they don't yet attend school. He also takes care of two other people.
This is his first loan from ACB Ltd. He is going to use the loan to buy more sugar, rice and salt to sell in his shop.

Appolinaire tries very hard to understand the demands of customers which helps him to satisfy their needs.
With the profits, he intends to grow the business and ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to increase the capital of his shop.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is 51 years old man, married with three children.  He sells food products as macaronis, butter, cookies, sugar, fruits and vegetables, and, beverages in his shop.  Kamil has 12 years of experience in this field, which considers him as knowledgeable and skilled person.

Food product he sells is very popular among people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 250 AZN. His wife helps him to sell products in shop. He is very successful entrepreneur because of good location, in the central bazaar of his home city.

Profit he gains is not enough to reinvest it to business and covering customers` demand is suffering for this reason. Being only one source of income, his profit is used for family needs. Kamil would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital. For this purpose he applied for 1000 AZN. He will purchase and diversify additional food stuff. Kamil has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to diversify and purchase additional food stuff.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a responsible and devoted wife. She expresses her devotion to her spouse and three children. Though they are less fortunate, she still finds ways to generate an income. Together with her spouse, they plant and harvest rice to sell to traders in their village. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 so that she can help make her crop more productive. She will buy fertilizers and MAGNUM (an herbicide) to use in farming.

Someday, she aims to lift her family out of poverty by making her crop produce an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and Magnum (an herbicide)

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is a responsible wife and mother of three children. She is married to Mr. George, a farmer in the village of Namnama, Cabatuan. Myrna is the operator of a transport motorcycle, with a net profit of PHP 250 daily. She has had this business for over nine years. Myrna wants to repair her motorcycle, which is why she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy spare parts such as wheels and paint and to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to repair and improve her business and earn a higher income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Buying and selling meat and vegetables is the primary source of income for Lolita, a mother of two school-aged children. She is a 37 years old and married to Mr. Alfredo, a farmer in the village of Namnama, Cabatuan. She has been in this business for several years. She earns approximately PHP 2,000 per week. As of now, Lolita is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase different kinds of vegetable such as eggplant, string beans, potato and meat to sell in their local community. She hopes to expand her business to earn a higher income and lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of vegetables and meat to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Hog raising is the major source of income for Gloria. She is 51 years old and still single. Gloria has been engaged in hog raising for five years. She usually earns about PHP 7,000 per head. Gloria is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP because she has insufficient capital to buy additional stock of feeds and medicine for her hogs. She would like to raise hogs continuously to save enough money for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her hogs

loans.name: C 7930 Twegerane Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 29 years old and has three children between 5 and 12 years of age. She sells rice in her business, which is open from 6 am until 5 pm per week except on the weekend. She currently employs four people to help her. She is the leader of the group called "C7930 TWEGERANE" in the local language. She is raising her hand in the photo. 

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her agriculture business by cultivating more rice to sell. With any profit, she will be able to buy fertilizer for growing rice and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to expand her agricultural business by cultivating more rice to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 44 years old and married, with no children. She owns and manages a variety store selling different grocery items. Her aim is to improve her small business to earn income to support her parents and to save for the future. She has operated her business for almost 13 years and usually earns a profit of PHP 10,000 a month, which is normally spent for food, clothing, medicines and to save for future emergencies.

Thelma would like to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' needs. She is asking for a loan of PHP 35,000 to buy additional stock of frozen foods, candies, rice, dried fish, snack foods, sugar, eggs, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks to sell in her store. 

She mentioned the loan will help a lot to improve her variety store. She hopes that some day she will become financially stable and her business will grow and become more viable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of frozen foods, candies, rice, dried fish, snack foods, sugar, eggs, noodles, canned goods and soft drinks to sell in her store.

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en:
Oktay is a 57-year-old man who is married and has five children. He is a market vendor and sells different kinds of food products in the central bazaar. Oktay has more than 20 years of experience in this field, which means he is considered as a knowledgeable and skilled person.

He usually sells rice, macaronis, yoghurt, ketchup, sugar and other things. The products he sells are in very high demand and people use them in everyday life.  Also these products are in very high demand among local people and his monthly profit is 300 AZN. 

This business is the only financial income for his family and Oktay would like to increase his sales as well as to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 1,800 AZN.  He will use this loan to purchase more products.  He has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more food products

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 47 years old and married. He has four children. 

He grows rice and earned P12,000 last crop. He has been engaged in this activity for over ten years. This activity is difficult yet he inspires to work just for the welfare of his children’s education and the improvement of his family’s living.

He is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and fuel for his functioning tractor. With these inputs and his hard work, he knows that he can gain higher income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and fuel for a functioning tractor.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Due to hardships of life, Milagros engages herself in selling grocery items in her village to generate additional income. She is now 50 years old and has four children, three of whom have already graduated from college while the youngest is still in college. Despite this financial difficulty, she wants to improve their status of living and continue sending her youngest child to earn a degree. 

Milagros aimed to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional P22,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, junk food, noodles, canned goods, detergent soaps, beverages and fish sauce to sell in her store. She believes that her loan will be a great help for her to make an improvement in her business and she hopes that she will become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, junk food, noodles, canned goods, detergent soaps, beverages and fish sauce to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Honorable

texts.en:
Honorable is 44 years old and lives in Gonzaga. She is married and has nine children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past fifteen years, she has been working hard to help her husband in managing their farming business. 

To help expand their business, she has requested a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used for the improvement of their business. It will help Honorable to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future she will be able buy more farm land to operate.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used for the improvement of their farming business

loans.name: Appoline

texts.fr:
Appoline fait le commerce des habits en detail et fabrique les paniers de culture rwandaise (uduseke). Elle a 46 ans. Elle est mariée et a 6 enfants dont le plus petit a 5 ans et le plus petit a 18 ans. Deux de ses enfants vont à l'école. Elle n'a pas d'une autre personne en charge. Appoline a 3 ans de sécondaire.
C'est le 3ème cycle qu'Appoline a avec ACB Ltd. Elle va utiliser le crédit danns l'augmentation du capital des habits et fabrication des paniers.
Dans le futur, Appoline prévoit de pénétre dans tous les marchés du pays. Avec le profit, elle va agrandir son business et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Appoline has a business of selling clothes and also makes traditional Rwandan baskets (uduseke). She is 46 years old. She is married and has six children. The youngest is five and the oldest is 18. Two of her children are in school. She doesn't take care of anyone else. She has three years of secondary school.
This is her third loan from ACB Ltd. She is going to use the money to increase the capital in her business of clothes and basket weaving.
In the future, Appoline intends to penetrate all the markets in the country. With her profits, she will grow the business and ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to increase the capital for her business of clothes and basket weaving

loans.name: Mary J.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school located in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. The school serves above 1,000 pupils and employs sixty teachers. In operation for fifty-nine years, the school receives support from the government to help cover its operating costs.

However, for many of the teachers here, life can be a struggle. Many teachers therefore engage in side projects and small businesses in order to supplement (or in some cases replace) their salaries, and these teachers are collectively seeking a loan of 5 million 4 hundred thousand SLL from SMT and Kiva lenders.

Mary is the leader of this group of teachers. She is forty-seven-years old. Mary is married and together they have two children. Mary plans to use her portion of the funds to pay school fees and other school charges for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees and other school charges for her children.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 50 years old, married and has four children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village to supplement her husband's income. With her husband, she planned to improve their sources of living and educate all their children so that they will have a bright future. Despite problems and difficulties in life, they have the determination to work out their plan. 

Nancy aims to acquire additional stock of soft drinks, canned goods, sugars, coffees, noodles, breads and soaps to sell in her store. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional 15,000 Philippines pesos to buy the said additional stocks. She believes that her variety store will grow and become viable as she continues to work hard and manage her business well.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, sugars, coffees, noodles, breads and soaps to sell in her store.

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Jayvee

texts.en:
Jayvee is 21 years old, single and lives with his parents. He is a farmer who grows rice. He sells his harvested crops at their market to make a profit. He earned about PHP 10,000 for the last crop and he wants to surpass this amount for the improvement of his family’s living and his business as well.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides, which are what he uses the most to take care of his crops. He just hopes that his loan will help him increase the family income and attain his dream of buying a plot of land to save for his future family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Christoper

texts.en:
Christoper is 32 years old, single, and lives with his parents in their community. He helps his parents with their farming business. He has plans to develop his own family but he feels badly about leaving his parents. He wants to provide all their necessities before he commits to married life.

He is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to improve his business. This will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide. These would be a great help to grow grow healthier crops to make more money. He could then save enough funds for his family and for his future family as well.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Roscon

texts.en:
Roscon is 29 years old and still single. His ambition in life is to become financially stable before getting married and settling down. He has planned to save more money to support the education of his younger brothers and save for his future. He has used his motorcycle transport in his village to earn income. Despite problems and competitors in the area, he still earns a profit that he uses to provide for his necessities and save some money for his future. 

He is asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy wheels, sprockets, bearings and gasoline needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He believes that if he works hard, he will earn more income and is hoping that he will achieve his goals someday.

loans.use: to buy wheels, sprockets, bearings and gasoline needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle transport

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 46, married and has three school-age children. Due to financial difficulty, she engages in providing manicure and pedicure service in her village to earn additional income. She aims to educate her children to earn a degree so that they will find a good job someday. Despite problems and difficulties in her life, she has the confidence to make her business grow.

She is requesting a loan of P8,000 to buy the needed cosmetics to provide pedicure and manicure service in her village. She mentioned that through her patience and hard work, she can able to improve her business and make it profitable.

loans.use: to buy the needed cosmetics for providing pedicure and manicure services in her village

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Darlindo

texts.en:
Darlindo is 35, married and has two school-age children. He aims to improve his income to provide for his family needs and to support the education of his children. The main source of his income is through farming and the buying and selling of coconut. He also uses his motorcycle transport to earn additional income.

Due to financial difficulty, he is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy wheels, gasoline and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle transport. He believes that this loan will enable him to continue to use his motorcycle to earn income. He hopes that he can improve his status of living and provide his family a bright future.

loans.use: to buy wheels, gasoline and other spare parts needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle transport

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Heherson

texts.en: Heherson is a responsible husband and father of three children. He is married, and lives in the village of Del corpuz, Cabatuan. Heherson is the operator of a transport motorcycle, with a net profit of PHP 250 daily. He has had this business for over five years. Heherson wants to repair his motorcycle, That is why he is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy spare parts such as wheels and paint for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to repair and improve his transport motorcycle business and earn a higher income to support his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as wheels and paint for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is a 48-year-old farmer who has grown rice for almost 20 years. He earned PHP 12,000 with his last crop. He is aiming for a higher income by the next cropping so he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to purchase fuel for the tractor to plow his farmland. He needs to do maintenance on his crops so that the land continues to provide better crops. And of course with his hard work, he could generate enough income to cover his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and fuel

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
To earn a living, Ligaya engages in cooking and selling of food for meals and snacks in her village. She loves to cook different recipes because she is knowledgeable in cooking. She is now 56 years old and has four adult aged children. She started her business when she was separated from her husband due to family conflicts or misunderstandings. Being a hard working mother, she has been able to support the needs of her family.

She aims to continue and improve the business, increase her income and acquire basic necessities. Yet, due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional P8,000 to buy pork, fish, vegetables and seasoning to be cooked and sold in her village. She mentioned that this loan will be helpful in the improvement of her small business and she is hoping that she will become financially stable someday.

loans.use: to buy pork, fish, vegetables and seasoning to be cooked and sold in her village

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia believes that, " An optimistic person will become successful". She is 48 years-old and a mother of five. The main source of their living is through farming, but they also use their motorcycle transport to earn additional income. Two of their youngest children are still at the college level and they are in need of financial support. 

Therefore, Ofelia want to continuously use their motorcycle transport to earn additional income. She is asking for a loan of P9,000  in order to buy exterior wheels, interior tube, oil, jet sprocket, chain, bearing and gasoline needed for the maintenance of their motorcycle transport. She mentioned that through patience and hard work, she will increase her income and satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to buy exterior wheels, interior tube, oil, jet sprocket and chain, bearing and gasoline for a motorcycle transport.

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Isaias

texts.en:
Isaias is 41 years old, married and a responsible father of five children. He has a farming business, which he hopes will help him maintain his family in good living conditions. Isaias knows that while working on the land is very difficult and risky, he can attain his wish for his family, because caring a lot about his business will always bring a profit. 

Isaias is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use in his farming business to help make sure that he will earn a high profit for the next crop season. Through his tirelessly working his farming business, he knows that someday he could be able to own a large coverage of farm land.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use in his farming business.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is 30 years old, married to Athens and blessed with three children. The couple are farmers who have been growing rice for over eight years. This income is how they are able to send their three children to school. She wants to maximize her income through asking for a loan of P13,000 which will be used to buy seeds and fertilizer for growing healthier rice. This will be of great help to increase their income so that they may purchase basic needs for her family and for savings. Hopefully, she will save enough funds to buy a plot of land they can use as an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for growing rice

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 39 years old and is married with two children. She lives with her family in a village and generates her income through vegetable sales. She earns about PHP 4,000 a month. She aims to earn more income to provide for her family's needs and to save money for the future of her children.

She wants to plant more vegetables and is expecting to increase her production. She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer to increase her vegetable production. She believes that the loan will help her to increase her yields. She is hoping that she is going to harvest a large volume of vegetables and earn a higher income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to sustain her vegetable production

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma, 52 years old, is the mother of five adult-aged children. She lives happily in a village in the Philippines. Norma has owned and managed a variety store in their village for almost 15 years. She usually earns a profit of PHP 6,000 a month, which she has used to acquire the family's necessities and finance the children's education. Through patience and hard work, Norma has educated all her children and most of them are employed. 

Norma still aims to continue and improve her business in order to earn and save for daily living and future emergencies. She is asking for additional capital of PHP 18,000 to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, eggs, soaps, beverages, junk foods and soft drinks to sell in her store. She is hoping that she will improve her business and make it a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, eggs, soaps, beverages, junk foods and soft drinks to sell in her store

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: To improve his farming business, Alexander has requested a loan of P10,000 from Alalay Sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. It will be used to buy fuel for his tractor, seeds, fertilizer and pesticide. This money would be a great help to Alexander to generate greater profit and store more rice for his family in order to avoid high cost of rice. He hopes that in the future he will be able to finish up his children’s education and gain a degree himself.

loans.use: to buy fuel for his tractor, seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Her sari-sari store (variety store) is the major source of income for the family. Ceferina is 55 years old and is married. Ceferina has been engaged in her business for many years and usually earns 250 PHP per day.

As of now, Ceferina is requesting a loan of 27,000 PHP to acquire additional grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, curls, bakery bread and other basic ingredients to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to acquire additional grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, curls, bakery bread and other basic ingredients to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr:
Christine fait l'agriculture des pommes de terre. Elle est veuve, âgée de 42 ans. Elle a 3 enfants âgé de 12 à 21 ans. Tous ses enfants vont à l'école. Christine n'as pas d'autres personnes en charges. Son niveau d'éducation est de 5 ans secondaire.
C'est son premier cycle de crédit avec ACB Ltd. Avec son crédit, Christine va acheter des semences des pommes de terre ainsi que les angrais chimique. Elle va aussi payer la main d'oeuvre des agriculteurs qui ont cultivé ses champs.
Christine veut devenir dans le futur un grand agri-éleveur dans sa région. Pour se faire, elle va moderniser son agriculture.
Avec le profit, elle va scolariser ses enfants et améliorer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Christine grows potatoes. She is 42 years old, and a widow. She has three children ranging from 12 to 21 years old. All of her children attend school. Christine is not responsible for anyone else. She has five years of secondary school education.

This is her first loan cycle with ACB Ltd. With her loan, Christine will buy potato seeds as well as chemical fertilizers. She will also pay the farmers who work in her fields.

In the future, Christine wants to become a big farmer/breeder in her region. To do so, she is going to modernize her farming.

With the profits, Christine will educate her children and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemical fertilizers, and pay workers

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old and is blessed to have two children. She lives with her family in a village.

To generate income, she grows vegetables. She explains that she typically earns approximately 25 PHP per day from her farming activities. She aims to earn more income so that she can better meet her family's everyday needs and save for her children's future.

At this time, she would like to plant more vegetables in order to increase her production, but she lacks the capital to do so. So, she is seeking a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy seeds and fertilizers. She believes that the loan proceeds will enable her to increase her crop yields. And harvesting a large volume of vegetables will then allow her to generate additional income to support her family.

loans.use: to expand her farming operations by purchasing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a responsible person. She is married with four children. She has been managing her hog-raising business for twenty years. After taking care of the hogs for four months, she sells them, earning 5,000 Philippine pesos per head. 

Angelita wants to help her husband uplift their standard of living. Sometimes Angelita has had difficulties in providing feed for her pigs. This was the reason she decided to request a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed for her pigs. She will look to the success of her business to extend help to her family in times of financial shortage.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a 27-year-old farmer. He runs his farm with the help of his wife. They work hand-in-hand in order improve their living situation. They were blessed with two children.

Wilfredo is industrious in his farming business, but he feels so worried because of the high costs of inputs used in farming. How could he provide for the needs of his family? He was so grateful to know about Alaalay sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. and their program of lending additional capital.

Wilfredo is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides as primary needed inputs in growing his business. He hopes to yield better crops through these inputs in order to save for his obligation to ASKI.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 37-years-old and is married. She is thankful because she has been blessed with two children. Erlinda has a retail store based in her home and she is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000 to invest in merchandise to stock up on items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients. She has been running her business for seven years and she is thankful because her income has been increasing.

Her family is her motivational guide in improving her business. She is working hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income and allows her to support her children in their studies. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise to stock up on items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 46 years old and is married with four children aged 2, 3, 5, and 7. He is in the business of selling shoes to earn a living. He has been in this business for 12 years. 

Since Andrea joined Faulu Kenya he has been able  to develop his business and has employed two people. He hopes to expand his business and become financially stable in the future. Andrea has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar is 34 years old. He started to plant and harvest rice ten years ago. He is a very industrious man and works daily on his rice field, but he still wants to improve his crop production to meet all his family’s needs. He has five children, all of whom attend school. Three are in high school while the rest are still in elementary school. 

As of now, he has insufficient funds so he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for maintenance of his crop. 

In the future, Jomar would like to keep earning funds for the college education of his children, so that someday they can earn a degree and have good employment.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides for maintenance of his crop.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 48 years old and lives with her husband and five children.

She is a farmer who has been growing rice for 20 years. She has been helping her husband since their crops had a definite decline. She is not amenable to that repeating because working in the field is difficult and very expensive.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 for additional capital to continue working in her business and to buy fertilizer to maintain her crops. With the help of this loan she will be able to meet the basic needs of her family and be free of financial problems.

loans.use: to obtain capital to continue working in her business and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a 48-year-old mother who aims to improve the standard of living of her family and become financially stable. She has three school-age children and wants them to finish their studies so that they can become professionals. Despite the difficulties of daily life, she and her husband help each other to achieve their objectives. Her husband patiently manages their rice farming business while Daisy manages their variety store.

She aimed to increase her product offering to satisfy her customers' needs, but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 19,000 to buy soft drinks, rice, canned goods, frozen foods, charcoal and vegetables to sell in her store. She believes that this loan will help a lot to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, canned goods, frozen foods, charcoal and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 34-year-old, married woman. She and her husband, Juan, are blessed with three children.

For the last ten years, she has worked as a farmer. Specifically, she and Juan grow rice.

Rosemarie now wants to expand their farming business to earn higher profits, which will be used to pay for their children's education. As a result, she is seeking a loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP to purchase seeds for planting, fertilizers, and pesticides. She would be very grateful if she could increase her crop yield through this loan.

loans.use: To expand her farming business by purchasing seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo is a 43 year-old married man who has three children. He has grown rice for the last 15 years and usually sells it to his good customers. Danilo earned PHP 10,000 from his last crop. He would like to increase it by asking for a loan of PHP 12,000  to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his crops. He hopes to gain a higher income to help with the high cost of purchasing food and his family's other basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Reymunda is 38 years old, and is married. She has been managing her hog-raising business for almost two years. She describes herself as patient and industrious.

Her business serves as a source of income for the family and helps her provide for their daily needs. Now she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed for her piglets. She wants to develop her business, to earn a higher income and save some of it for any future emergencies in her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets.

loans.name: Roston's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school in Kenema city. Teachers of this noble institution have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of SLL 3,150,000 for the entire group. With the help of this loan, this group of teachers will be able to improve on their standard of living. 

Forty-seven-year-old Roston is the leader of this group of teachers. Roston was born in a place call Kpuwabu. He is married and has four children, two in primary school, one in secondary and the other is not attending school. 

Roston is a teacher and has been in the teaching profession for 20 years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy house-building materials: bags of cement, iron corrugated zincs, nails, etc., for the construction of a family house. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some certain tasks that they would otherwise have not being able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials: bags of cement, iron corrugated zincs, nails, etc. for the construction of a family house

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is engaged in agriculture, particularly in a farming business. She is 37 years of age and blessed with five children. She is a very industrious mother and wife.

Ruby will keep on developing their farmland through her loan amount of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in growing crops as an improvement to her business. These inputs would be able to yield a greener profit and slowly and successfully increase her financial investment that would be used for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides used in growing crops

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 28 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She lives with her family in a village and generates her income through vegetable farming. She earned about 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a day. She aims to earn more income to provide for her family's needs and save money for the future of her children. 

She is trying to plant more vegetables, expecting to increase her production. But due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production. She believes that the loan will help her to increase her yield. She is hoping that she is going to harvest a large volume of vegetables and earn a higher income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to sustain her vegetable production

loans.name: Rizvan

texts.en:
Rizvan is 42 years old, married, and has two sons.  He sells food products such as macaroni, butter, cookies, sugar, jam, and beverages in his shop.  Rizvan has four years of experience in this field and is a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular and in high demand. His monthly profit from selling food is 150 AZN. His brother helps him to sell products in his shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because he has a good location in the central bazaar of his home city.

The profits he earns are not enough to reinvest in his business and, for this reason, meeting customers` demand is difficult. He uses his profits to meet his family's needs. Rizvan would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital in his business. So, he has applied for a loan of 1800 AZN. He will diversify and purchase additional food stuff. This will be his fourth loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to diversify and purchase additional food stuff.

loans.name: Lenilyn

texts.en:
Lenilyn is 35 years old, married, and blessed with three children. Since childhood, she was conscious of the piggery business of her parents. So when she could not finish her education, she put up her own hog fattening business. This is one of their sources of income, because her husband also operates a farming business. They are helping each other to raise their children in a comfortable way. 

As a result, she is requesting a loan of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy feed for further development of her piggery business. Through her persistence and perseverance, she hopes to successfully develop her business to bring in a high income.

loans.use: to buy feed for further development of her piggery business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary ann is married and has one child. Mary ann's child entered college but did not earn a degree and she has chosen to be at home. Mary ann is married to Pedro, a farmer in their village. Mary ann also helps her spouse do farming activities such as planting and harvesting rice for sale. Their income serves as their sustenance for meals, bills and allowance for their child. Mary ann still needs to make her crops productive so she is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow.

Hopefully, Mary ann can make her crops produce an abundant harvest so that she can earn funds to make her family financially stable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is trying to sow more vegetables, expecting to increase her production. But due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of 6,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production. She believes that the loan will help her to increase her yield. She is hoping that she is going to produce a large volume of vegetables and earn a higher income to support her family's needs. 

Mercedita is 53 years old, a responsible wife and mother of three children. She lives with her family in the village of Del corpuz. She aims to earn more income to provide for her family's needs and save for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to sustain her vegetable production

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: Arsenia is a 53-year-old who has been engaged in the hog fattening business for the last 10 years. She is married and has four children. Arsenia breeds hogs and sells them for a profit in their market after three to four months. She earns about 2,000 PHP each disposing season. She wants to exceed her last profit in order to uplift their living situation. As a result, she applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feed and three hogs as an additional source of income. Hopefully, she will gain high profit by the next disposing season to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and three hogs as an additional source of income.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Paticia is a farmer in her village and plants and harvests rice for sale. This kind of business allows her to gain an income for the sustenance of her family. She is married to a farmer and they have three children. As of now, the couple has insufficient funds to sustain her crop and labor cost. She is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers that will help transplant rice seedlings in a hectare rice field Patricia and her husband cultivate. 

In the future, she hopes that her crop will become more productive so that she can alleviate her family's current poor living situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor cost in transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 45 years-of age and married with four children. She has been hog raising for over five years. She is very patient to do this activity because it brings to her family a good profit. 

Currently she feels financial difficulties because of her children who are presently in school. For this reason, she is asking a loan of P8,000 in order to buy feed and two more hogs to care for. She cares a lot for her business in order to overcome her difficulties in improving her business. She hopes for a productive outcome of her hard work and patience.

loans.use: to buy feed and two more hogs to care for.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad is 42 years old and married with two children. He sells office supplies and has 10 years of experience. During these years, he gained deep knowledge and the necessary skills to understand market demand and cover his customers` demands.

Elshad's business is successful because the products he sells are in high demand. His permanent clients are schoolchildren and offices. His monthly profit from the business is 200 AZN. 

Elshad`s profit is not enough to reinvest his profit into his business. Hence, meeting customers` demands is not possible. To improve the situation and increase the number of products, he applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN. He has already demonstrated himself as a good client with a positive credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more office supplies

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 50 years old, married and blessed with two children. Her children already live separately and have their own family. Through her determination, hard work and of course her sari-sari business, she had finished her children’s education. In her store business, she offers snack foods such as biscuits and soft drinks and beauty products like face powder.

Emilia has been in this business for over 4 years and hopes to grow it further. Because of her wish, she decided to request of loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional snack foods and beauty products to sell.  She is happy for having Alalay sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. for financial assistance. In the future, she hopes to achieve her wish to become a successful entrepreneur and have a comfortable life with her husband as well.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack foods and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is married and is a responsible mother of one infant child. She is 22 years of age. She is very happy to have her child, who serves as her strength as she pursues her piggery business. When her husband goes into the field, she stays at home to look after her child and her pigs. She patiently cares for the pigs in order to earn a high income when she sells them. 

Currently, she is seeking a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional feed for her pigs. This will be a great help to make her pigs healthier and fatter. She hopes to expand her business and make a good profit to save for the future of her child.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50 years of age. She is married to Johny, a farmer in the village of Del Corpuz. Editha is engaged in the poultry business. She usually raises ducks and chickens. She earns about 150 PHP per head. She is thankful, because aside from her poultry business, she is also engaged in a hog-raising business.

In order to continue improving her business, she is applying for a loan of 27,000 PHP to buy more ducks and chickens to raise and hog feed to sustain her hog-raising business. Her only wish is for her business to grow and she is hoping that she can save some funds to support her family's needs. According to her, she could make all these things a reality through her patience and hard work in maintaining her business.

loans.use: to buy more ducks and chickens to raise and hog feed to sustain her hog-raising business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 46 years old, married and blessed with three children, all of whom are currently studying. She wants them to finish their chosen courses and have a good life someday. 
Aida has been engaged in her hog-fattening business for five years. She runs the business to provide for her children while in school. She is aiming for healthy and nourished pigs in order to earn a high income at disposing season. She is now asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes for further improvement in her piggery business to improve her family's poor standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar is 49 years old, married, and has three children.  He sells food products such as macaroni, butter, cookies, sugar, tea, candies, and beverages in his shop.  Ilqar has eight years of experience in this field and is a knowledgeable and skilled person.

The food products he sells are very popular and in high demand. His monthly profit from selling food is 200 AZN. His son helps him to sell products in his shop. He is a very successful entrepreneur because he has a good location in the central bazaar of his home city.

However, the profits he earns are not enough to reinvest in the business and, for this reason, meeting customers' demands is difficult. He uses his profits  to meet his family's needs. Ilqar would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital in his business. So, he has applied for a loan of 1800 AZN. He will diversify and purchase additional food stuff. This will be his third loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to diversify and purchase additional food stuff.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is  37 years old. She is married to Edwin, a farmer in the village of Del Corpuz. Raquel is recognized as a jolly and industrious person. She has been running her sari-sari (variety) store for almost five years, and earns about PHP 300 daily. She wants to buy additional grocery items, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase canned goods, noodles, bakery bread, curls and other kitchen ingredients to sell. Raquel hopes to grow her business and to secure her family future with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, bakery bread, curls and other kitchen ingredients to sell

loans.name: John Gil

texts.en:
John Gil is a diligent father. At the age of 22, he already has two children. He only finished his high school education, so his business is planting and harvesting rice for sale. But he is a proud farmer. His main goal right now is to earn funds for the education of his children so that someday they can seek better employment than him in his farming activities. He cultivates a two-hectare rice field.

He has insufficient funds to sustain his crops due to a typhoon that affected his crop production last harvest season in November. He would like to ask for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy five bags of urea (fertilizer) and five liters of magnum (pesticide) used in farming to continuously grow rice seeds for the betterment of his output and his family's economic situation as well.

loans.use: to buy five bags of urea (fertilizer) and five liters of magnum (pesticide) to be used in farming.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en: Rema is 55 years old, married and has five children. She raises hogs as a source of income. She has been in this business for over 20 years and it is a great help to her family's living situation. Rema wishes to care for healthy and meaty pigs so she requested a loan of P8,000 to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs. These would be a help in attaining good profits.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Matda

texts.en:
Matda is 25 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer, while she is involved in hog fattening business. They are assisting each other for the improvement of their living situation. And as a hog raiser, it is difficult for her to continue running a business without financial assistance. A business would not be operating successfully.

In connection to this, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase two more hogs, feed and vitamins. Hopefully, she will expand her business and increase for the development of their poor living.

loans.use: to purchase two more hogs, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
At her age of 47, Norma still strives hard to generate an income for her family. She is married to a farmer and hand-in-hand they work untiringly to make their crop produce abundant harvests every harvest season in April and November. 

She is now asking for a loan to maintain her crop. She is asking for PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. 

Norma and her husband wish to achieve their goal for abundant harvests so that they can make improvements on their small house and especially for the education of their three children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a patient and determined mother who plants and harvests rice for sale. She is 46 years old, married, and lives in Bangag. This kind of business was the family's primary source of income. Together with her husband, Julieta has been in the farming business for 20 years. The couple still strives hard to make their crop fruitful. 

They have insufficinet funds right now, so they decided to borrow a loan of P20,000 for sustenance for their crop. Julieta will use the loan to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and molluscicides to be used in farming. They also promised to pay this loan on time. 

In the future, Julieta hopes to achieve her dreams of helping her four children become professionals in their chosen careers and finding a way to lift their family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and molluscicides to be used in farming

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly's name is suitable for her personality. She is a jolly person and has been married for five years. She is now 24 years old and only finished high school. Her spouse works overseas and also sacrifices a lot to generate an income. The couple have no children yet but aspire to have them soon. Jolly raises crop for an additional income instead of lazing at home. She pays labourers who help her plant and harvest rice to sell. As of now, she is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. Through her sacrifices, patience and the help of this loan, she hopes to make her crop more productive, earn a higher income and someday alleviate her family's poor financial situation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Melvina

texts.en:
Melvina is 42 years old, married and has three children. Both her and her husband are involved in rice farming. The income from this kind of business is just enough to cover their basic needs especially school expenses of her children. She hopes to increase her output so she is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy five bags of UREA and four liters of MAGNUM fertilizer and pesticides to use in farming.

Someday, she would like to earn consistent profits from the development of her business, provide education for her children, and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy five bags of UREA and four liters of MAGNUM fertilizer and pesticides to use in farming

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is patiently generating income from her farming business. With her husband, she plants and harvests rice to sell after harvesting. A one-hectare rice field is just a 10 minute walk from her house. She has been in this kind of business for almost six years and earns approximately P10,000 each harvest season (April and November). 

Rosario decided to borrow P15,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow. She had insufficient funds so she is asking for this loan.

Rosario would like to keep earning funds for the college education of her two young children and help them become professionals some day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 52 years old and has been widowed for almost 10 years. She carries the burden alone in supporting the needs of her two children. Through her farming business, she has provided funds for college education of her children. Her business of planting and harvesting rice for sale keeps growing but she still aspires to make it more productive. She is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow and to pay for labor cost in transplanting rice seedlings. 

Through her perseverance and determination, she hopes to make improvements on her less-fortunate living conditions and keep saving funds for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow and to pay for labor cost in transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a responsible housewife who helps her husband to manage their rice farming business. She is blessed with four children and they live happily in a village. Due to the high cost of basic commodities, she and her husband need to earn more income to satisfy their basic needs. 

Zenaida and her husband aimed to increase their yields so that they could earn a higher income. However, due to financial difficulty, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to pay for labor costs required for planting rice. Zenaida and her husband believe that through patience and hard work, they will have a plentiful harvest this coming season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for labor costs required for planting rice

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is married and has four children. She is 43 years old and has been raising hogs for nine years. She is very proud that she sent her children to school. Together with her beloved husband, she is slowly improving her family's living condition. 

At present she wishes to have healthy pigs to earn a high income. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins. This could possibly expand her sales volume, which can help her to achieve a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Gemalyn

texts.en: Gemalyn is 33 years old, married and blessed with one child. She lives in the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan where she generates income through her rice production.  She has been in her business for 11 years. She usually receives a net profit of PHP 30,000 every crop season. As of now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers to sustain her rice production business. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old, married, and has three children. They live happily in a village and have a plan to improve their standard of living and to give their children a better future. Farming is one of their major sources of income: they plant and harvest rice for sale. They have been in this business for more than 25 years and usually earn a profit of 30,000 PHP in every harvest season. 

At this time, Teresita is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for the labor cost required for a rice plantation. They believe that this loan will be an enormous help for them to increase their yield.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
Andres is willing to work hard every single day in his rice farm business, because he wants to give his family a good quality of life.

Andres is 44 years old and lives with his family in the village of Rang-ay, Cabatuan. He hopes to sustain his farm business so as to be able to send his children to school, and to give them a good quality of life.

Andres' current aim is to improve his rice farm business, but he doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizer and seedlings. Andres hopes to sustain his farm business for the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his rice farm business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 38-years-old and is married. She earns a living by growing corn in the Philippines. Analyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Analyn has been farming corn for fifteen years and earned approximately PHP 20,000 with her last harvest. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Esmenia

texts.en:
Esmenia has been engaged in her rice farm business for 33 years and she usually earns P45,000 per crop year. She is willing to work hard every single day to lift her family out of poverty. Esmenia is married to a farmer who helps her manage their farm. According to her, through the income generated from her business, she has been able to give daily allowances to her children who are currently in school. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan of P25,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain her rice production. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain her rice production.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 39 years old, married and has seven children, three of them are currently going to school. To make a living, Mary Jane is involved in the farming business. She has been in this business for over 22 years. She received PHP 14,000 from her last crop. 

Now, Mary Jane is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase corn seeds and fertilizers. She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business, and she hopes that she will have a fruitful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 52 years of age, married and has four school-aged children.  She is a hard-working woman, who helps her husband in their farming business. She has been in this field of business since she was married to her husband (1980). Together, they are working and put all their strength in their business for the family's welfare.
