She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. This loan would be a great help in improving their source of income. She hopes to increase the yields of her crops through her purchase inputs by next cropping season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 29 years of age and has been in farming for three years since marrying Reny. They are blessed with three children. She is very dedicated to farming because she didn’t finish her education. If she cannot work, they would feel the agony of being poor. And she doesn’t want her family to suffer from that difficulty.


To avoid this, she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the development of her farming business. She just hopes to attain abundant crops by next crop season to have a comfortable and contented life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the development of her farming business.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hard-working mother who owns and manages a variety store in their village. She is 44 years old and was blessed with two children. Being hard-working parents, they have been able to support their children's education and to acquire their basic necessities. But due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to improve her business so that they will be able to meet all their needs especially for their children's schooling.

Elma is asking for additional capital of PHP 35,000 to buy noodles, biscuits, candies, canned goods, soaps, seasonings, soft drinks, beverages and fish to sell. She believes that she can improve her business if she continues to manage it well. She hopes that her business will grow and become viable in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, candies, canned goods, soaps, seasonings, soft drinks, beverages and fish to sell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a married woman from the town of Cabatuan, the province of Isabela. She and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow crops of rice to sell. Josie does her best to improve their business and take care of their children.

Josie is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase quality seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. Josie hopes to have a bigger farm in the future. She also hopes to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a mother who is blessed with five children. While doing the household chores, she finds time to help her husband manage their corn plantation in order to ensure that there is a good harvest. Despite the hardships in farming, they are able to endure because they want to earn and save to satisfy their needs and to support their children's needs.

They would like to expand their corn plantation, but they have inadequate capital. Therefore, Rosie is asking for additional capital of 20,000 PHP to buy corn seed, fertilizers, insecticides and pay the labor costs required to plant corn. They believe that this loan will help them improve the business, and they hope that they will have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizers, insecticides and to pay the labor costs required to plant corn

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
In order to further increase the number of crops, Jovita is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farming business. She is 45 years old, married and has four children. She aims to have a comfortable life with her family someday, that’s why she is hard-working and persistent in developing their source of income. 

Hopefully, with her loan and hard work, she can easily achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her farming business

loans.name: Enedina

texts.en:
Enedina is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children. She is a housewife and at the same time a farmer, because she is helping her husband in operating their farming business. She was thankful for having a very persistent and hard-working husband, because she is not in difficulty in operating her business in the field.

To develop their business, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides as maintenance. She plans to invest the profits from this loan for emergency purposes and for the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides as maintenance.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is a small entrepreneur who sells rice grain, livestock feeds and charcoal to the people in her village. He did not have a stall to stock his products so he sells on a house-to-house basis. He has been patiently doing this for almost five years. He would like to improve and diversify his business, so he is now asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy charcoal, rice grain, and livestock feed to sell. He would like to make his business more profitable so that he can provide enough sustenance for his family, especially for future expenses in the college education of his only child.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, rice grain, and livestock feed to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en: Alejandra is a 43-year-old farmer. She is married and has three school-aged children. Since 1992, when she was married to Alfring, she has been successfully running a farming business. With the help of her very industrious husband, they earned about 13,000 PHP in the last harvest. In order to increase this amount, she has asked for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides to sustain her crops. She just hopes to achieve abundant income from her crops so that she may invest in another business--specifically, the hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to sustain her crops.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 36 years old, married and has three children to educate. She has been in her business of selling different items such as slippers, frames and bags for five years. She usually earns about PHP 10,000 each month and has just enough for children's school fees, meals and bills at home. 

She has insufficient funds now so she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy boxes, frames, slippers, bags and accessories to sell. She would like to sell more items to improve her business and to be able to save for future expenses.

loans.use: to buy boxes, frames, slippers, bags and accessories to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 55 years old and raises hogs as a source of income. She has three children who live separately, as they already have their own families. Because of that, she needs to work for herself and her husband. She has been in this business for more than ten years and proudly says that their living situation right now is better than before.

To completely overcome their poverty, she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feed and vitamins. It will surely develop her business and raise their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a jolly and industrious person, who has been engaged in growing rice for 30 years. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. She usually plants and harvests rice to sell. Juanita works hard through her rice farm business to lift her family out of poverty. 

Right now, Juanita is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy seed, fertilizers and insecticides to sustain her farm production. She hopes to maintain her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers and insecticides to sustain her farm production

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 36 years old and is married to a farmer. Vilma also helps her spouse in planting and harvesting rice to sell. They have been in this business for almost 15 years. Vilma usually earns about PHP 10,000 each harvest season. It usually falls during the month of April and November. 

Vilma has three children. Two of them go to school. She aims to educate them up to college so that they earn a degree. According to her, she needs to strengthen her business to meet her goal. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides use in farming.

Hopefully, she will have good financial management to make her family financially stable so that they will not have to borrow from traders or neighbors to finance their crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Matusalem

texts.en: Matusalem is 39 years old and is married. He earns a living by growing rice in the Philippines. Benites is borrowing PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Matusalem has been farming rice for 12 years and earned approximately PHP 35,000 last crop season. He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream: to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 53 and has three adult-age children. She owns and manages a variety store in their village to earn additional income for their daily living. Most of their children are already married and manage their own families. She still aims to improve her variety store to increase her income and satisfy their necessities and save for future emergencies.

She is asking for an additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, beverages, shampoos, snack foods, candies and soft drinks to sell. She mentioned that this loan will allow her to increase her product offerings and satisfy the needs of her customers. She believes that her hard work will make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, beverages, shampoos, snack food, candies and soft drinks to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 47 years old, married to Pedro and blessed with four children. She is engaged in the farming business and is unable to find sufficient financial resources to develop her farm. Rebecca has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000. 

With the requested loan, she would purchase fertilizers and pesticides to maintain her farm. This means that her business would improve and would provide better crops by the next harvesting season. Surely, their living conditions would uplift.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to maintain her farm

loans.name: C8038 Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Therese is 35 years old and is married with four children between the age of one and eight years.  Therese sells beans.  She is the president in this group which is called "C8038 Abadahemuka".  Her business is well organized, she employs one person to help her and works from 6am until 1pm every day, with five years of experience.

Therese has requested a loan from Kiva lender via Vision Finance company in order to purchase more beans to sell.  With this profit, Therese will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more beans to sell.

loans.name: C9272 Itezimberemugore Group

texts.en:
Marie is 30 years old and a widow with two children between the ages of 7 and 10 years old. Her business is well organized. She employs one person to help her and operates from 6 am until 6 pm every day. She has three years of experience.

Marie has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more fruits and vegetables to sell. With the profits from the loan, Marie will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Indatwa/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Adèlle est membre du groupe INDATWA et fait le commerce des poules. Elle a 38 ans, mariée et ayant 8 enfants dont le plus petit a 2 ans et le plus grand a 18 ans. Il a une personne en charge et 4 de ses enfants vont à l’école.
C’est  le 2ème cycle de crédit qu’Adèlle fait avec ACB Ltd. Avec le crédit, Adèlle veut augmenter le capital injecté dans son commerce.
Sa stratégie pour être la première vendeuse des poules dans la région est l’augmentation du capital pour acheter en grande quantité les poules.
Avec  le profit, elle éduquera et fera soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Adèlle is a member of INDATWA and she sells hens. She is 38 and a mother of 8. Her youngest child is 2 and the eldest is 18. She has one dependent adult and 4 of her children go to school.
This is Adèlle's second loan cycle with ACB Ltd. With this loan, Adèlle wants to increase her business's working capital.
Her strategy to be the number 1 hen seller in her region is to increase her working capital so she can buy a large quantity of hens.
The profit will enable her to pay for her children's school fees and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of hens.

loans.name: Khoy

texts.en:
Khoy, age 56, sells cows. He buys cows from his village and nearby districts and raises them at home. When the cows are fully grown, he sells them to a middleman who comes to buy at his home. His wife, Sokleang, age 55, is a commune leader assistant. 

They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have one son and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, two are garment workers and the other one is in school. 

Khoy is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy additional cows to raise.

loans.use: To buy additional cows to raise.

loans.name: C2399 Zamuka Group

texts.en:
Jean d'Arc is 26 years old and is married with one child who is two years old. Jean d'Arc sells rice, soap, salt, sugar, beans, etc. She is the president of this group called "C2399 Zamuka" Her business is well organized. She employes one person to help her and starts from 5:30 am until 8:30 pm every day. She has three years of experience. 

Jean d'Arc has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more quantities of rice, sugar, soap, salt and beans to sell. With this profit, Jean d'Arc will reinvest in her business and save money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, soap, salt, sugar, etc to sell.

loans.name: Pricila

texts.en:
Pricila is 47 years old and has three children.  She is married to Donato, a farmer in their village. To make a productive profit, she also helps her spouse in farming activities such as planting and harvesting corn. Their income serves as their maintenance for their daily needs and the allowance of her child. 


She wants to have an abundant harvest by next cropping season so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to grow. Hopefully, she can attain her objective so that her family will be financially problem free.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and corn seeds to grow

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 42 years old, married, and a farmer living in the Philippines. With her spouse, she raises rice crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice to sell. For an additional income, Alma also raises pigs and chickens in their backyard for future sales.
 
Alma has four children. She is untiringly involved in this business to generate an income to provide a good education for them. As of now, she has insufficient funds in her farming business so she is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow. 

Alma is hoping that this coming harvest season of April, her crop will produce abundantly to make her farming business more profitable and save for future expenses of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 47 years old.  She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 16 years. Her business is well-organized.  She sells charcoal and works from 6am until 7pm every day.  Jacqueline employs three people to help her.  She has three years of experience in her businesss.

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more sacks of charcoal to sell. With this profit from the loan, Jacqueline will be able to buy more food for her family and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: C8026 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Jean Paul is 33 years old and married with five children between the ages of 2 and 9 years old. He sells Fanta, milk, tea, and beer in his business, which is open from 6 am until 7 pm every day. He currently employs one person to help him. He is the leader of his group, which is called "C8026 Tuzamurane" in the local language. He is in the middle on the left side. Jean Paul has three years of experience in this business.

Jean Paul has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more quantities of Fanta, milk, tea, and beer to sell. With this profit, Jean Paul will save money for the future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: C8036 Turwanyubukene Group

texts.en:
Venansia is 24 years old. She is married and has two children between the ages of 2 and 3 years.  Venansia sells meat. She employs two people to help her and works from 6am until 6pm every day. She has two years of experience in her business. She is the presidente of this borrowing team, which is called "C8036 Turwanyubukene" in the local language.

Venansia has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more quantities of meat to sell.   With this profit, Venansia will be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell

loans.name: C9255 Abishyishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Fred is 43 years old and is married with four children between the ages of ten and twelve.  His business is well organized, he sells sorghum, beans and maize.  His business starts from 7 until 12 every day with two years of experience.

Fred has requested a loan from Kiva loan partner Vision Finance company in order to expend his business by buying more beans, maize and sorghum to sell. With the profits from the loan, Fred will be able to reinvest in his business and to save for future.

loans.use: to purchase more sorghum, beans and maize to sell.
